The owner of this account is Mr. Charles Ishigbe. He died on 12th January, 1995. Since I got your contact, I have been expecting his next of kin to come over and claim his  money because we cannot release it unless someoneapplied for it as next of kin or relation  to the deceased as indicated in our banking guidelines.  However,  the banking law and guideline here in Burkina-faso  stipulates that if such money remains unclaimed after a period of (4)three years,it will be  transferred into the bank treasury as unclaimed bill. The customer Mr. Charles Ishigbe  was one of the prime offenders here and I have been advising the bank to release  the money to his heirs since he is still a foreigner and the holder of  foreign account, he is not entitled to this privilege. The need for assistance and the business opportunity it represents in  terms of investment opportunities are such that I am willing to offer you 10% of the money for your  assistance in transferring this money to your account as compensation for your assistance. Do not be alarmed and beleave this business as you are not legally supposed to  handle this money and I will provide all necessary information that will facilitate  the transfer to your account. At the conclusion of this business, you will be given 35% of the money while 70% will be for me and my family ; please, if you are  willing to assist us, contact me immediately via email for more details on how we can execute  this transaction. Please, always treat this matter with utmost confidentiality and  secrecy. Indicating your highest regard for the  success of this transaction.Yours faithfully, jimmy  Gill. Monash Bank.

ATTN: I am Mr thomson kabob, the Bank Manager of Amalgamated Bank of South Africa Plc[East] Cape Town Branch. I have urgent and very confidential business proposition for you.On June 6 1999, an America Oil consultant/contractor with the South Africa Mining Corporation, Mr. John Huang made a numbered time (fixed) deposit for twelve calendar months, value  US$20,000,000.00(Twenty Million Dollars) in my branch upon maturity.  Upon maturity, I sent a routine notification to his forwarding address but got no reply.  After a month, we sent a reminder and finally we discovered from his contract employers, the South Africa Mining Corporation that Mr. John Huang died from an automobile accident.  On further investigation, I found out that he died without making a WILL and all attempts to trace his next of kin were fruitless.  I therefore made further investigation and discovered that Mr. John Huang did not declare any kin or relations in all his official documents, including his Bank Deposit paperwork in my Bank. This sum of US$20,000,000.00 and the interest is being rolled over with the principal sum at the end of each year. No one will ever come forward to claim it.  According to the South Africa Law, at the expiration of  (seven) years, the money will revert to the ownership of the South Africa Government if nobody applies to claim the fund.  Consequently, my proposal is that I will like you as a partner to stand in as the next of kin to Mr. John Huang so that the fruits of this old man's labor will not get into the hands of some corrupt government officials. This is simple, I will like you to provide immediately your full name and address so that the attorney will prepare the necessary documents and affidavits that will put you in place as the next of kin. We shall employ the services of an attorney for drafting and notarization of the WILL and to obtain the necessary documents and letter of probate/administration in your favor for the transfer. A bank account in any part of the world that you will provide will then facilitate the transfer of this money to you as the beneficiary/next of kin. The money will be paid into your account for us to share in ratio of 60% for me and 35% for you and 5%  for Expenses Incurred in the course of the transaction .There is no risk at all as all the paperwork for this transaction will be done by the attorney and my position as the Branch Manager guarantees the successful execution of this transaction. From: Mr. Charles W. Smith
Title:  RE:confidential and urgent business transaction/business proposal from Mr. Charles W. Smith. General Manager, Plantation and Mariana Island Solid Gold Corporation. I want to first introduce my self to you for our mutual business/personal benefit, but I sincerely seek your confidence in this transaction, which I propose to you with trust and confidence. I am Mr. Charles W. Smith, the General Manager Plantation and Mariana Island Solid Gold Corporation. Our client, Mr. Allan Wong, a foreigner, made a numbered fixed deposit for 18 calendar months, with a value of Twenty Four million Five hundred thousand United State Dollars only, in my branch. Upon maturity several notice was sent to him, even during the war in countries like Syria and Iraq. Again after the war another notification was sent and still no response came from him. We later find out that the funds had been dormant in his account for 4 years. After further investigation it was also discovered that Mr. Allan Wong did not declare any next of kin or relations in his official papers including the paper work of his bank deposit. And he also confided in me the last time he was at my office that no one except me knew of his deposit in my bank. So, Twenty Four millions Five hundred thousand United State Dollars is still lying in my bank and no one will ever come forward to claim it. What bothers me most is that according to the laws of my country at the expiration 4 years the money will revert to the ownership of the Hong Kong Government if nobody applies to claim the fund. Against this backdrop, my suggestion to you is that I will like you as a foreigner to stand as the next of kin to Mr. Allan Wong so that you will be able to receive his fund.  WHAT IS TO BE DONE: I want you to know that I have had everything planned out so that we shall come out successful. I have contacted an attorney that will prepare the necessary document that will back you up as the next of kin to Mr. Allan Wong, all that is required from you at this stage is for you to provide me with your Full Names and Address so that the attorney can commence his job. After you have been made the next of kin, the attorney will also fill in for claims on your behalf and secure the necessary approval and letter of probate/Administration in your favor for the move of the funds to an account that will be provided by you.  SECURITY OF THE FUND:  We are going to invest the money in a lucrative business venture, so we will need your safekeeping for the investment. That is why I wanted you to send me your safe bank account for the fund and also provide me with your biometrics to enable the attorney will get to your data base.  I want us to transact this business in a legal manner, so the attorney will use all legal means to obtain the necessary approvals, to avoid violation of the law, please you should receive his urgent reply through the above email box,  Yours faithfully, Mr. Charles W. This sum of $26,300,000.00 is still in my bank and the interest is being  rolled over with the principal sum at the end of  each year. No one will ever come forward to claim it.  According to accepted banking practice in my country, at the expiration  of  (seven) years, the money will revert to the ownership of the Dutch Government if nobody applies to claim  the fund. From: stefan obi
Title: URGENT BUSINESS ASSISTANCE
 URGENT BUSINESS ASSISTANCE Dear Sir, I am Mr.Stefan Obi a merchant in authority Hospital No-9 in the Federal Capital Territory, Freetown,I have urgent and very confidential business proposal for you. On June 6, 1999, an America Oil consultant/contractor with the Federal Government of Nigeria, Mr. Charles Ballassi made a numbered time (fixed) deposit for twelve calendar months, valued at USD$25,000,000.00(Twenty-five Million Dollars) in my branch upon maturity. I sent a routine notification to his forwarding address but got no reply. After a month, we sent a reminder and finally we discovered from his contract  employers, the Federal Government of Nigeria that Mr. Charles Ballassi died from an automobile accident. On further investigation, I found out that he died without making a WILL, and all attempts to trace his next of kin was  fruitless. I therefore made further investigation and discovered that Mr. Charles Ballassi did not declare any kin or relations in all his official documents, including his bank deposit paperwork in my bank. This sum of USD$25,000,000.00 is still sitting in my bank and the interest is being rolled over with the pricipal  FUND at the end of each year. No one will ever come forward to claim it. According to Nigerian Law, at the expiration of  (seven) years, the money will revert to the ownership of the Nigerian Government if nobody applies to claim the fund. Consequently, my proposal is that I will like you to stand as the next of kin to Mr. Charles Ballassi, so that the fruit of this old man's labor will not get into the hands of some corrupt Government officials. This is simple, I will like you to provide immediately your full name and address so that the attorney will prepare the necessary documents and affidavits that will put you in place as the next of kin. We shall employ the services of an attorney for drafting and notarization of the WILL and to obtain the necessary documents and letter of probate/administration in your favor for the transfer. A bank account in any part of the world that you will provide will then facilitate the transfer of this money to you as the beneficiary/next of kin. The money will be paid into your account for us to share in the ratio of 70%for me and 25% for you and 5% for Expenses Incurred in the course of the transaction . There is no risk at all as all the paperwork for this transaction will be done by the attorney and my position as the Branch Manager guarantees the successful execution of this transaction. If you are immediately via this email address immediately. Please observe utmost confidentiality, and rest assured that this transaction would be most profitable for both of us because I shall require your assistance to invest my share in your country. Awaiting your urgent reply. Reply to:stefanobi@myway.com

From: amiri birre 
Title: GOOD DAY
 GOOD DAY FROM MR AMIRI BIRRE. BILL AND EXCHANGE MANAGER, BANK OF AFRICA (BOA) OUAGADOUGOU BURKINA FASO. Dear Friend, I am MR AMIRI BIRRE, the man Gave you this contact. I got your contact from the internet while I was searching for a reliable person through internet who can assist me in this transaction. In my department we discovered an abandoned sum of $ 20 billion US dollars (twenty-five billion USD) in an account that belongs to one of our bank foreign customer who died along with his entire family on (Mar. 15.2001) in a plane crash. Since we got information about his death, we have been expecting his next of kin to come over and claim his money because we cannot release it unless some body applies for it as next of kin or relation to the deceased as indicated in our banking guidelines, but unfortunately we learnt that all his supposed next of kin or relation died along side with him at the plane crash leaving nobody behind for the claim. It is therefore upon this discovery that I and other officials in my department now decided to make this business proposal to you and release the money to you as the next of kin or relation to the deceased for safety and subsequent disbursement since nobody is coming for it and we don't want this money to go into the bank treasury as unclaimed bill. The banking law and guideline here stipulates that if such money remained unclaimed after a period of (Ten)two years, the money will be transfered into the bank treasury as unclaimed fund. The request of foreigner as next of kin in this business is occasioned by the fact that the customer was a foreigner, and a Burkinabe cannot stand as next of kin to a foreigner. We agree that 20% of this money will be for you as foreign partner,in respect to the provision of a foreign account, 10% will be set aside for expenses incured during the business and 70% would be for me and my colleagues. There after I and my colleagues will visit your country for disbursement according to the percentages indicated. Therefore to enable the immediate transfer of this fund into you account, you must apply first to the bank as relations or next of kin of the deceased indicating your bank name, your bank account number, your private telephone and fax number for easy and effective communication and location where the money will be remitted. Upon receipt of your reply, I will send to you by fax or email the text of the application. I will not fail to bring to your notice that this transaction is hitch free and that you should not entertain any atom of fear as all required arrangements have been made for the transfer. You should contact me immediately as soon as you receive this letter. Trusting to hear from you immediately. Your's faithfully, MR AMIRI BIRRE.

Title: From: Mr. Jame Edward
 From: Mr. Jame Edward From: Mr. Jame Edward Tel:  874-76-2258537 Fax: 874-76-2258537 E-mail address: jame_edward@zwallet.com Attn:Sir/Madam You may be surprised to receive this letter from me since you don't know me personally. I am Dr.Jame Edward who works with the Zonguldinger family trust bank here in South Africa. I got your contact through one of their overseas branches. Upon further investigation, I must also inform you that I have packaged a financial transaction that will benefit both of us at the end of the transaction. During our investigation and auditing in one of their branches , I found a sum of 17.500 million US dollars. The source of this money was a deceased customer of their bank who died in a plane crash and no next of Kin or relation of the deceased has been found hence the money is floating and if I do not remit this money out urgently it will be forfeited for nothing. The owner of this account is Mr. John Anderson a foreigner and a sailor. He died on the 23rd July 2000. and no next of kin or relation of the deceased has been found hence the money is floating and if I do not remit this money out urgently it will be forfeited for nothing. The nature of his death and no other person knows about this account and my investigation proved to me as well that he died without making a WILL. So the money is floating and if I do not remit this money out urgently it will be forfeited for nothing. I got your contact through a family friend who works with the bank so I decided to seek for you out. On further investigation, I found out that he did not declare any next of kin or relation to any of his offshore clients in any of his official documents, including his bank deposit paperwork in my bank. This sum of 17.500 million US dollars is still sitting in my bank and the interest is being rolled over with the principal sum at the end of each year. No one will ever come forward to claim it.According to the Laws of South Africa, at the expiration of 7 (seven) years, the money will revert to the ownership of the South Africa Government if nobody applies to claim the fund. My proposal is that I will like you to stand as the next of kin to Mr. John Anderson so that the proceeds of this account valued at US$27.5 million will be released to you as the next of kin to the bank account. When this money gets to you, you will be entitled to 20% of the total amount, 70% will be for me and my partner, while 5% will be set aside for any expenses that may be incurred during the course of this operation. Please, you have been advised to keep top secret as I am still in service and intend to retire from service after we conclude this deal with you. I will be monitoring the whole situation here in the bank until you confirm it over there in the Cayman Islands and then send the money to your bank account here in South Africa for onward disbursement according to the percentages indicated. To start the process of the transaction, you will first apply to the bank as the next of kin to Mr. John Anderson so that the entire arrangement will start from the beginning. After you apply, I will send to you a text of application which you will send to the bank account of Mr. John Anderson which you will open in the bank. I will also issue you a letter of application which you will send to the bank which will open the bank account you will open in the bank. When you have received the texts of both applications, I will send to you both letters of application. I want to assure both of you that this transaction is 100% risk &amp; trouble free. I have pictures to prove it. I need your collaboration to see it through. Thanks for your anticipated co-operation. Best regards, Mr. Jame Edward.

Title: Urgent urgent response
 Urgent urgent response Dear Sir,  I have a confidential business proposition for you.On June 6, 2000, a British Oil consultant/contractor with the Nicaraguan National Petroleum Corporation, Mr. David Ameeraly, made a numbered time (fixed) deposit for twelve calendar months,valued at 10,000,000,00 U.S.Dollars (ten million, six hundred thousand U.S. dollars) in my branch upon maturity.                       On the delivery of the date, we sent a routine notification to his forwarding address but got no reply. After a  month, we sent a reminder and finally we discovered from his contract employers (the Nicaraguan National Petroleum Corporation)  that Mr. David Ameeraly died from an automobile accident.  On further investigation, I found out that he died without making a WILL, and all attempts to trace his next of kin was  fruitless.  I therefore made further investigation and discovered that Mr. David Ameeraly did not declare any next of kin or relations in all his official documents, including his bank deposit paperwork in my bank. This sum of 10,000,000,00 U.S. dollar is still sitting in my bank and the interest is being rolled over with the principal sum at the end of each year. No one will ever come forward to claim it.  According to the laws of my country at the expiration of 7 (seven) years, the money will revert to the ownership of the Nicaraguan Government if nobody applies to claim the fund.  Consequently, my proposal is that I will like you as a person to stand in as the next of kin to Mr. David Ameeraly so that the fruits of this old man's labor will not get into the hands of some corrupt government officials. This is simple, I will like you to provide immediately your full name and address so that the attorney will prepare the necessary documents and affidavits that will put you in place as the next of kin. We shall employ the services of an attorney for drafting and notarization of the WILL and to obtain the necessary documents and letter of probate/administration in your favor for the transfer. A bank account in any part of the world that you will provide will then facilitate the transfer of this money to you paid into your account for us to share in the ratio of 60% for me and 40% for you.  There is no risk at all as all the paperwork for this transaction will be done by the attorney and with my position as the credit officer guarantees the successful execution of this transaction.If you are immediately via this email address immediately. Upon your response, I shall then provide you with more details and relevant documents that will help you understand the transaction. Please send me your confidential telephone and fax numbers for easy communication.  Inquire as much or as little as you want concerning this transaction.Please observe utmost confidentiality and be rest assured that this transaction would be most profitable for both of us because I shall require your assistance to invest my share in your country.  Awaiting your urgent reply.  Yours is wm_guzma@mail2world.com

Title: TREAT VERY CONFIDENTIAL &amp; URGENT RESPONSE.
 TREAT VERY CONFIDENTIAL &amp; URGENT RESPONSE. FROM THE DESK OF MRS M. TUGU.BANGKOK. BANGKOK,THAILAND Dear, I hope this may not constitute sort of embarrassment to you at this stage in time, But I am seeking your co-operation and trust to enable me present you in a more positive light. The present Government has voted, on fourteenth of July, 1999, to close down all pending cases of unclaimed deposits from Bangkor-Seki,   which included gold and silver mines. This came as a shocker to the Government as they were expecting the depositor to come over and claim his money. It is for this reason that I and my coleagues in the Ministries of Mining and Natural Resources are having a problem in the country. It is to this end that I and my colleagues in the Ministries have been excused to look for a foreign partner in a country of our choice who will assist us in receiving this money and invest it there in a profitable venture. We have been made to sign a binding agreement, which was signed, to bind us together. It is from this that I and my colleagues got the knowledge of the Bangkor-Seki Solid Gold and Silver Mines in Southeast Asia. This mine was owned by the Chinese and their leaders and was under the management of one of their foreign customer who died along with his entire family in a plane crash on his way to attend a business deal in the Middle East. When we came to the knowledge of his death, we made this discovery and the deal was cancelled because of his death. The sudden death of this customer was a surprise to all of us and we lost confidence with the Chinese. After discussion with my colleagues, it was decided that we would transfer this money to a foreign account which they kindly agreed to provide. This is because I have the authority of the Director of Contracts Removals to approve this transfer. This money has been floating around the bank for some years now and the bank has no idea about this account. As a matter of fact, the account has no record of a deposit or withdrawal. On the contrary, from what I gather from the accounts and bank records, the account has no next of kin and if I was not careful, this money will one day be forfeited to the bank treasury as unclaimed bill. I and my colleagues have decided to do this because we are government workers and our pay chevrons are not sufficient to cover this unclaimed fund. I do not want this unclaimed fund to go into the bank treasury as unclaimed fund. I have been made to sign a binding agreement, which was signed, to bind us together. I was made to sign a binding agreement, which was signed, to bind us to a mutual agreement. Hence, my motivation to seek your consent to present you to the bank as the next of kin of the deceased. Under the laws of Bangkor-Seki, all bank accounts of deceased â€” including this one â€” shall be traced to the last owner of the account before the bank administration is made to make the necessary enquiries and contact the account of the person whose account this money was originally deposited. He must, however, apply to the bank as the next of kin to the along with his direct and his day care centre where he now lives for his money to be acknowledged as the next of kin. On this note, I have been made to sign a binding agreement, which was signed, to bind us together. I was made to sign a binding agreement, which was signed, to bind us to a mutual agreement. Hence, my motivation to seek your consent to present you to the bank as the next of kin of the deceased. Under the laws of Bangkor-Seki, all bank accounts of deceased â€” including this one â€” shall be traced to the last owner of the account before the bank administration is made to make the necessary enquiries and contact the account of the person whose account this money was originally deposited. He must, however, apply to the bank as the next of kin to the along with his direct and his day care centre where he now lives for his money to be acknowledged as the next of kin. On this note, I have been made to sign a binding agreement, which was signed, to bind us together. I was made to sign a binding agreement, which was signed, to bind us to a mutual agreement. The money will be paid into your account for us to share in ratio of 60% for me and 30% for you and 10 % will be set aside for expenses incured during the business. There is no risk at all; The paperwork for this transaction will be done by the attorney and my position as the Branch Manager guarantees the successful execution of this transaction. On January 9, 1999, an American Oil consultant/contractor with the government of Zimbabwe, Mr. Stephen Morris made a numbered time (fixed) deposit for twelve calendar months, valued at US$8,000,000.00 (Eight Million Seven Hundred and Fifty Thousand Dollars) in my bank. Upon maturity, I sent a routine notification to his forwarding address but got no reply. After a month, we sent a reminder and finally we discovered from his contract employers, the government of Zimbabwe that Mr. Stephen Morris died from an automobile accident.  On further investigation, I found out that he died without making a WILL and all attempts to trace his next of kin was fruitless. I therefore made further investigation and discovered that Mr. Stephen Morris did not declare any next of kin or relations in all his official documents, including his bank deposit paperwork in my bank. This sum of US$8,000,000.00 is still sitting in my bank and the interest is being rolled over with the principal sum at the end of each year. No one will ever come forward to claim it. According to the Laws of Zimbabwe, at the expiration of (Seven) years, the money will revert to the ownership of the government if nobody applies to claim the fund. Consequently, my proposal is that I will like you to stand as the next of kin to Mr. Stephen Morris so that the fruit of this old man's labor will not get into the hands of some corrupt government officials. This is simple, I will like you to provide immediately your full names and address so that the attorney will prepare the necessary documents and affidavits that will put you in place as the next of kin. We shall employ the services of an attorney for drafting and notarization of the WILL and to obtain the necessary documents and letter of probate/administration in your favor for the transfer. A bank account in any part of the world that you will provide will then facilitate the transfer of this money to you as the beneficiary. The money will be paid into your account for us to share in the ratio of 60% for me and 40% for you. There is no risk at all as all the paperwork for this transaction will be done by the attorney and my position as the Branch Manager guarantees the successful execution of this transaction. If you are immediately via this private email address immediately. Upon your response, I shall then provide you with more details and relevant documents that will help you understand the transaction. Please observe utmost confidentiality, and rest assured that this transaction would be most profitable for both of us because I shall require your assistance to invest my share in your country. Awaiting your urgent reply. Thanks for your prompt response. Sincerely,  Mrs. Juliet Armand

I am Mr Thompson Umutha, the Bank Manager in  my branch.I was startled this morning  when I received a call from a British national about doing a business deal with  me.he said he has something to disclose regarding a customer of our bank who died on  Monday, 15th of June, 2000, with his entire family at his bedside. and his  British next of kin died also.As he stated in his letter of deposit, he died with  a sealed bank account in the Royal Bank of  Hong Kong, the Bank has been  expecting his next of kin to come and get his money because he died  as next of kin and subject to the banking rules and guidelines of my country, but unfortunately  all  his supposed next of kin's or relation died alongside with him at the plane  crash leaving nobody behind for the claim. It is because of this problem that I  decided to seek for a foreign  partner in a country of my choice where i will transfer this money and use  it for investment purpose such as real estate management or hotel management,  since this money has no person or company to whom it can be traced  and the person who is to act as next of kin  or beneficiary to the deposit will be responsible for all  expenses  incured during the business. I will be forwarding to you the contact of the foreign  partner who should act as next  of kin to the deceased. PLEASE YOUR CONFIDENTIAL  TRANSFER REQUIREMENTS: 1) YOUR PRIVATE TELEPHONER ADDRESS AND  (REFERENCE) FULL NAMES OF  YOUR BUSINESS ASSOCIATES. 2) YOUR PRIVATE TELEPHONER ADDRESS AND  (REFERENCE) FULL NAMES OF  YOUR BUSINESS ASSOCIATES. 3) HIGH COMMISSIONERS RETURN FORM. 4) YOUR PRIVATE TELEPHONER ADDRESS AND  (REFERENCE) FULL NAMES OF  YOUR BUSINESS ASSOCIATES IF YOU ARE NOT AT LEAST 18 YEARS OR OLDER. 5) YOU CANNOT BE A PARTNER OF CRIMES. 6) YOU CANNOT BE A PARTNER OF CRIMES. I AM THE BANK MANAGER IN  MY BANK AND I AM IN THE PLAYING OF HARD CRITICISM BY YOU. PLEASE REPLY ME BACK TO YOU SO THAT I CAN  REPLY BACK TO YOU AS SOON AS POSSIBLE FOR FULL IDEA OF YOUR COMPENSATION.  BEST REGARDS, Mr Thompson Umutha.

From: Mrs. Linda Price.
 I , am writing to seek your co-operation and assistance in the context stated below:My husband Mr.Blankhill was a Gold and Diamond merchant in Abidjan , the economic capital of Guinea . He was poisoned to death by his business associates on one of their outings on business . When my husband was alive he had in his accounts at the Deposit Depository of our Bank in Abidjan , deposits valued at 16 million United State Dollars only, ( 16m US Dollars). Also taken away from his account were these: A bank account in Hong Kong, a secure bank account in Europe , and gold and diamond consignments worth millions of dollars. They also took away a gold medallions necklace. They poisoned him on one of their outings on business and buried him in a cemetery. My poor husband was poisoned by his business associates. Before his death we were sure he died of heart attack, because he did not communicate a word about this death. When he was alive he deposited the deposit of these consignments under the management of a Security Company in Europe . The consignment deposited in the security company was guarded with the company's seal of approval on it, so we took away the security company's seal and deposited this news of this happening in your private mailbox. Then we went to the security company to notify them that my husband was poisoned by his business associates. They sent us the file on deposit of these consignments with the security company. We are now waiting for the next of kin to come over to us for us to present them as the next of kin to my late husband. I am Mrs. Linda Price and I am the only surviving son of Mr.Blankhill Price, a Gold and diamond merchant from Ivory coast . I am black and I am divorced. My late husband had a policy of non-Black owned bank accounts. Because of this, I was afraid and worried when my late husband was poisoned by his business associates. I have since found out that my late husband was poisoned by his business associates and that I am the next of kin to my late husband. It is only to terminate this business opportunity that I have discovered that you may be able to assist me. Although I know that a transaction of this magnitude will make any one apprehensive and worried, but I am assuring you that everything will be well at the bank within a short while. As soon as I receive your reply, I will give you more details and relevant documents that will help you to proceed in the transaction. Please whenever you get this mail, reply me immediately through my secondary mail box: lp_price@tiscali.com. You should also include your private fax and telephone numbers for easy communication. Thanks and God bless. Ms. Linda Price Tiscali Limited. No 208.81.228.25. Alternative email address: lp_price@tiscali.com

  URGENT BUSINESS ASSISTANCE Dear Sir, I am Mr.Sushil B. Shah, the Manager in credit and foreign bills of one of the prime banks here in Africa. I have urgent and very confidential business propos of a transaction. On with my business I want to introduce a transaction that would be very beneficial to both of us. I got your contact from the international directory in my search for a reliable and trustworthy foreign partner. In my department we discovered an abandoned sum of $10.5m US dollars (Ten million five hundred thousand U.S. dollars) in an account that belongs to one of our foreign customer who died along with his entire family on the 8th of July 2000 in a plane crash.  Since we got information about his death, we have been expecting his next of kin to come over and claim his money because we cannot release it unless somebody applies for it as next of kin or relation to the deceased as indicated in our banking guidelines, but unfortunately we learnt that all his supposed next of kin or relation died alongside with him at the plane crash leaving nobody behind for the claim.  It is therefore upon this discovery that I and one official in my department now decided to make this business proposal to you and release the money to you as the next of kin or relation to the deceased for safety and subsequent disbursement since nobody is coming for it and we don't want this money to go into the bank treasury as unclaimed bill. The banking law and guideline here stipulates that if such money remained unclaimed after seven years, the money will be transfered into the bank treasury as unclaimed fund.  The request of foreigner as next of kin in this business is occasioned by the fact that the customer was a foreigner and a Cantonese must learn to read and write sign language.   We agree that 30 % of this money will be for you as foreign partner, in respect to the provision of a foreign account, 10 % will be set aside for expenses incured during the business and 60 % would be for me and my woman colleague.  I will be your foreign partner and you will instruct me on how to apply for the release of the money from the bank on your behalf.  Please, you have been advised to keep business as a secret between both parties.   Yours faithfully,  Mr.Sushil B. From: Mr.Erick
Title: urgent response 
 urgent response  &gt;From the Desk of Koutaba The Hon. Principal,EEOC.Liberia. Dear Friend, I am Mr.Koutaba The Hon. Principal,EEOC.Liberia. a member of Independent Committee of Eminent Persons (ICEP),Liberia.I have urgent and very confidential business proposition for you. On June 6, 1999, an America Oil consultant/contractor with Petroleum Corporation, Mr. David Ameeraly, made a numbered time (fixed) deposit for twelve calendar months,valued at US$25,000,000.00(twenty- five million united states dollars) in my branch upon maturity. I sent a routine notification to his forwarding address but got no reply. After a month, we sent a reminder and finally we discovered from his contract employers, the Petroleum Corporation that Mr. David Ameeraly, died in the plane crash On October 31, 1999, (an Egyptian Boeing 747 Airways Flight 990) with other passengers on board as you can confirm it from the website below.http://www.cbsnews.com/stories/1999/11/01/iran/main49778.shtml On further investigation, I found out that he died without making a WILL and all attempts to trace his next of kin were fruitless. I therefore made further investigation and discovered that Mr. David Ameeraly had actively opposed the government of his country, Ivory Coast,and is therefore now at large and unclaimed. We therefore made further investigation and discovered that Mr. David Ameeraly, unlike most unclaimed bodies, has a SIMPLE SETTLEMENT AND ACCOUNTANT FOLLOWING IF HIS FUND IS REMITTED. This sum of US$25,000,000.00 is still sitting in the bank and the interest is being rolled over with the principal sum at the end of each year. No one will ever come forward to claim it and according to the laws of my country at the expiration of 6(six) years, the money will revert to the ownership of Ivory Coast Government if nobody applies to claim the fund. My proposal is that I will like you to stand as the next of kin to Mr. David Ameeraly, so that the fruit of this old man's labor will not get into the hands of some corrupt government officials. This is simple, I will like you to provide immediately your full name and address so that I can forward to you your bank account information immediately and inform you about the modalities available to us. We can at this point quietly look for a reliable overseas interlocutor who will act as the next of kin to Mr. David Ameeraly, so that the transaction will be most profitably without the need for a hitch. At the termination of this business, you will be entitled to 25% of the total sum as compensation,70% for your effort/input/interest,5% for the expenses incurred during the course of this operation,10% for charitable purposes and 75% for the consumption of your own kind. Please, you have been advised to treat this information with utmost secrecy and confidentiality. I will be glad to hear from you immediately. Regards, Koutaba The Hon. Principal,EEOC.Liberia. ______________________________________ E-mail:kephd@latinmail.com

I am a national of Assista Island who has moved to Abidjan Cote d'Ivoire from Cote d'Ivoire where i work in the bank now.I am in charge of foreign customer accounts, bank account  and foreign remittance/ charge accounts in the bank. I have been in this bank for ten years having been  appointed as a bank director  to the bank's management board after ten years of the previous bank director who died with his entire family on November 13,2003 in an automobile crash. Since we got information about his death on a business transaction  that they  executed in the bank, we have been expecting his next of kin to come over and claim his money because we cannot  release it if it is not paid to him, but we learnt that all  his supposed next of kin or relations have been killed, and his bank account is surrounded by the security company where the bank director  is headquartered, and  the company cannot release the money unless somebody applies for it as next of kin or relation to the director as  indicated in our banking guidelines but unfortunately we learnt that all his supposed next of kin or relation died along side with him in the  crash leaving nobody behind for the claim. It is therefore upon this discovery that I sought your permission to open the account  in the bank to enable me send the money to whomever  I wish in the name of my bank to be the next of kin or relation of the director. As  we planned this, we executed an agreement with the bank which stipulated that if you agree to this, the money  would be released to you as soon as  you apply to the bank as the next of kin or relation of the director.Upon  receipt of your reply, I will forward to you by fax or email the text of the application. I will not fail to bring to your notice that this  transaction is 100%risk free; on smooth conclusion of this transaction, you will be entitled to 25% of the  total sum as gratifications,while 10% will be set aside for any expenses that  might be incurred by you in the course of the transaction. I am awaiting your instant reply reply through my alternative email account. You should also include your:  daytime and/or evening phone numbers for easy communication. Do not forget to include your fax number for easy and safe  retrieval. EXPECT YOUR REPLY. Yours faithfully, Mosesi Mballhe.

 Greetings from james obi ATTN: Sir/Madam. I am james obi a local Bank manager in Abidjan, Cote d'Ivoire.I got your email contact during my search for an overseas reliable contact.I was hoping you could be able to assist me in this transaction.Please,I need your assistance for two reasons.Firstly,as the Bank Manager  I have a policy of not permitting foreign accounts to  exist in my country. This is because, as the Bank Manager  of one of the prime banks here in Abidjan, I know of one account  opened by a foreigner with the account number 14-11-2957-801  which I will give to you if you are willing to be my partner.Secondly,I have  in my possession the account number 14-11-2957-801 which I will give to you  if you are willing to be my partner. In the course of our daily banking processions we discovered an account opened by a foreigner with the account number 14-11-2957-801. On further investigation we  discovered that the account has long been dormant and all trace of the account is  from the end of the last century. This sum of US$28M is still sitting in the dormant account and the interest is being rolled over with the principal sum at the end of each year. No  body will ever come forward to claim it. According  to the laws of the land at the expiration of  (seven) years the money will revert to the ownership of the Cote d'Ivoire  Government if nobody applies to claim the fund. We are looking for a foreigner who will act as the beneficiary to-  ensure that the money is successfully transferred over to any account  where you will be capable of receiving it. The person to be  beneficiary is on whose behalf we are interested, because the bank  considers any foreigner as a beneficiary,  regardless of his nationality. In fact, we are willing to give you 20% of the total  amount. But please, we need your full co-operation. If there is any such thing as  double binds in this transaction,it is it because we are still in negotiations with the bank over  the modalities to finally finalize this transaction. At the conclusion of this transaction, you will be given the  total sum of 210M, which is the difference  between the two sum. It is based on this that I got your contact. In  addition, you will be given 20% of the total amount, which is the  80% of the amount. Please, I want you and your company to stand as the real  beneficiary of this money,  so that no body will stand in the way of this money ever getting into  your bank account.I will be monitoring the whole situation here in Abidjan until you  agree to my last minute change of heart and to help me carry out this  transaction for which you are being offered 20% of the total  amount. Once you have been convinced  of your righteousness please contact me immediately so that we can proceed  resolving this matter together. Till then, remember to  contact me on my alternative email address: obi_24_legal@yahoo.co.uk  Best regards, james obi

From: John Paul Carton
Title: ASSISTANCE
 ASSISTANCE Dear Sir, I think it will be necessary to solicit your assistance in a business of this magnitude, but in a confidential manner.I work with the UNICEF Child & Adolescent Development Programme in some countries. I am the Regional Director in charge of the Early Childhood Development Programme in one of the industrialised countries. Recently I discovered an abandoned sum of US$16.5 million dollars (sixteen million five hundred thousand U.S. dollars) . In an account un-completed in the bank,the author had deposited this money in an account that belongs to one of our foreign customer who died along with his entire family in November 2005 in a plane crash. Since we got information about his death, we have been expecting his next of kin to come over and claim his money because we cannot release it unless some body applies for it as next of kin or relation to the deceased as indicated in our banking guidelines but unfortunately we learnt that all his supposed next of kin or relation died alongside with him at the plane crash leaving nobody behind for the claim. It is therefore upon this discovery that I and other officials in my department now decided to make this business proposal to you and release the money to you as the next of kin or relation to the deceased for safety and subsequent disbursement since nobody is coming for it and we don't want this money to go into the bank treasury as unclaimed bill. The Banking law and guideline here stipulates that if such money remained unclaimed after seven years, the money will be transfered into the Bank treasury as unclaimed fund. The request of foreigner as next of kin in this business is occasioned by the fact that the customer was a foreigner, and a Burkinabe cannot stand as next of kin to a foreigner. In view of this, it is very necessary that the money be transferred out of the bank without any delay and it is only by direct transfer that it can be transferred into any foreign account. The request of foreigner as next of kin in this business is occasioned by the fact that the customer was a foreigner, and a Burkinabe cannot stand as next of kin to a foreigner. In view of this, it is very necessary that the money be transferred out of the bank without any delay and it is only by direct transfer that it can be transferred into any foreign account. The request of foreigner as next of kin in this business is occasioned by the fact that the customer was a foreigner, and a Burkinabe cannot stand as next of kin to a foreigner. In view of this, it is very necessary that the bank make arrangements to get the additional sum of US$10 million dollars from the additional bank account of any of the banks located in Europe. I will be the first to admit that this proposal is strange but I believe that time is of the essence and we shall all work out the modalities to finalize this project smoothly. At the eleventh hour, however, it is possible that the bank might decide to block this transaction. I have the authority of my partners involved to propose that should you be willing to entertain this proposal, you should contact us immediately through our above telephone number. We would appreciate it very much if you could contact us immediately. In the light of all above, I am at your disposal to give you 30% of the total amount. However, you should not entertain any fear as we are on top of all arrangements to ensure a smooth transfer of the fund into any account nominated by you. I have reposed my confidence in you and hope that you will not disappoint me. Please, do not entertain any fear as all required arrangements have been made for the transfer. I wait in anticipation of your fullest co-operation, Yours sincerely, John Paul Carton.

From: Mr.Gonzalo Aubiner
Title: URGENT BUSINESS ASSISTANCE
 URGENT BUSINESS ASSISTANCE Mr.Gonzalo Aubiner, Bank of Botswana. PO BOX ZECHANO, Johannesburg South Africa. Tel: +874-76 39 19 30.  I am Mr.Gonzalo Aubiner, Bank of Botswana, House of Bank, South Africa. I have urgent and very confidential business proposition for you. On June 6 1999, a gold merchant/contractor with the South African Mining Corporation, Mr. Darby Ogwumukwu, made a numbered time (fixed) deposit for twelve calendar months,valued at US$15,000,000.00(Fifteen Million Dollars) in my branch upon maturity. I sent a routine notification to his forwarding address but got no reply. After a month, we sent a reminder and finally we discovered from his contract employers, the South African Mining Corporation that Mr.Darby Ogwumukwu died in the plane crash On October 31, 1999 air crash accident at Benin Republic Airport in Benin,  with other passengers aboaed as you can confirm it in your country's airline's website. On further investigation, I found out that he died without making a WILL, and all attempts to trace his next of kin through the South African Government were fruitless. I therefore made further investigation and discovered that Mr. Darby Ogwumukwu did not declare any kin or relations in all his official documents, including his bank deposit paperwork in my bank. This sum of US$15,000,000.00 and the interest is being rolled over with the principal sum at the end of each year.  I now seek your consent to present you as the next of kin to Mr. Darby Ogwumukwu, so that the fruit of this old man's labour will not get into the hands of some corrupt government officials. The banking law and order here in my country stipulates that if such sum of US$15,000,000.00 is not declared by the next of kin to Mr.Darby Ogwumukwu, the bank will report the whole transaction as farm fund.  Upon this discovery, I decided to do business with you and get your consent for the transfer of this money to your account.  At first, I will like you to entertain this thought as to why you are willing to assist us in this transaction. I got your contact from our chamber of commerce, I believe it was because of their low profile that we were able to collect this information. I am presently in need of a foreign partner to invest this fund into, but I can offer you 15% of the total amount, 10% for contingencies (cost of transfer/other charges) likely to be incurred during the transfer process and the remaining 70% will be for me as my investment.  If you are interested in this deal, kindly get back to me by sending me your private telephone and fax numbers for easy communication.  Please endeavour to keep this transaction confidential, to enable the transfer to move very smoothly in to the account you will prove to the bank.  Awaiting your urgent reply. Thanks and regards. Mr.Gonzalo Aubiner.

Title: Greetings from Mr. John Murrell
 Greetings from Mr. John Murrell Dear Sir/Madam, I wish to begin by introducing myself. I am Mr. john murrell a native of South Africa and I am an accountant with BNP Paribas. I have an urgent &amp; confidential business suggestion for you. On June 6, 2001, an America Oil consultant/contractor with Petroleum Corporation, Mr. John P.F. Hayward made a numbered time (fixed) deposit for twelve calendar months, valued at USD$24,800,000.00 (Twenty Eight Million Eight Hundred Thousand Dollars)prior to transfer to my account. Upon maturity, I sent a routine notification to his forwarding address but got no reply. After a month, we sent a reminder and finally we discovered from his contract employers, the Petroleum Corporation that Mr. John P.F. Hayward died from an automobile accident. On further investigation, I found out that he died without making a WILL, and all attempts to trace his next of kin was fruitless. I therefore made further investigation and discovered that Mr. John P.F. Hayward did not declare any next of kin or relations in all his official documents, including his Bank Deposit paperwork in my Bank. This sum of USD$24,800,000.00 is still sitting in my Bank and the interest is being rolled over with the principal sum at the end of each year. No one will ever come forward to claim it. According to the Nigerian Law, at the expiration of (seven) years, the money will revert to the ownership of the Nigerian government if nobody applies to claim the fund. My proposal is that I will like you as a partner to stand in as the next of kin to Mr. John P.F. Hayward so that the fruits of this old man's labor will not get into the hands of some corrupt government officials. This is simple, I will like you to provide immediately your full name and address so that the attorney will prepare the necessary documents and affidavits that will put you in place as the next of kin. We shall employ the services of an attorney for drafting and notarization of the WILL and to obtain the necessary documents and letter of probate/administration in your favor for the transfer. A bank account in any part of the world that you will bring will then facilitate the transfer of this money to you as the beneficiary/next of kin. The money will be paid into your account for us to share in the ratio of 60% for me and 40% for you and 10 % will be set aside for expenses incured during the business. There is no risk at all; The paperwork for this project will be done by the attorney and my position as the Branch Manager guarantees the successful execution of this transaction. If you are interested, please reply immediately to my email address. Upon your response, I shall then provide you with more details and relevant documents that will help you understand the transaction. Please send me your confidential telephone and fax number for easy communication. Please observe utmost confidentiality, and rest assured that this transaction would be most profitable for both of us because I shall require your assistance to invest my share in your country. Awaiting your urgent reply via email. Regards, Mr. John Murrell.

From:  Mr Richard Gormley
Title: RE:  REPLY    STRICTLY CONFIDENTIAL
 RE:  REPLY   STRICTLY CONFIDENTIAL Mr.Richard Gormley HOBBLESIDE (UNITED ARAB EMIRATES)  Dear Sir,  I am Mr.Richard Gormley, a native of Limpopo,  Republic of West Africa, and I am an executive accountant with the  African Development Bank (A.D.B)  in West Africa. We have urgent need for a reliable and competent foreign partner,  with whom we can carry out a successful transaction. On  September 6, 1999, an America Oil consultant/contractor with the  Petroleum Corporation, Mr. David Ameeraly, made a numbered time (fixed) deposit for twelve  calendar  months, valued at US$26,500,000.00 (Twenty four Million Five Hundred Thousand Dollars)  in my branch upon maturity. I sent a routine notification to his forwarding address but  got no reply. After a  month, we sent a reminder and finally we discovered from his contract  employers, the Petroleum Corporation that Mr. David Ameeraly died  from an automobile accident with his family along with his wife and only daughter.  On further investigation, I found out that he died without making a WILL, and all attempts to trace his next of kin were  fruitless. I therefore made further investigation and discovered that Mr. David Ameeraly did not declare any next of kin or relations in all his official documents, including his  bank deposit paperwork in my bank. This sum of US$26,500,000.00 is still sitting in my bank and the interest is being rolled over with the  principal sum at the end of each year. No one will ever come forward to claim it.  According to the Nigerian Law, at the expiration of  (Six)years, the money will revert to the ownership of the Nigerian government if nobody applies to claim the fund. Consequently, my proposal is that I will like you as a foreigner to stand in as the next of  kin to Mr. David Ameeraly, so that the fruits of this old man's labour will not get into the hands of some corrupt government officials. This is simple, I will like you to provide immediately your full name and address so that the attorney will prepare the necessary documents and affidavits that will put you in place as the next of  kin. We shall employ the services of an attorney for drafting and notarization of the WILL and to obtain the necessary documents and letter of probate/administration in your favor  for the transfer. A bank account in any part of the world that you will provide will  then facilitate the transfer of this money to you as the beneficiary/next of kin.  The money will be paid into your account for us to share in the ratio of 70% for me and 25% for you and 5%  for Expenses Incurred in the course of the transaction .  There is no risk at all as all the paperwork for this transaction will be done by the attorney and my position as the Branch Manager guarantees the successful execution of this transaction. If you are immediately via this e-mail address immediately.  Upon your response, I shall then provide you with more details and relevant documents that will help you understand the transaction.  Please send me your confidential telephone and fax numbers for easy communication.  If you are interested, please reply immediately to  me via this email address, with your full name,address, and the private telephone and fax number of your bank where the bank will transfer the money into.  Please observe utmost confidentiality, and rest assured that this transaction would be most profitable for both of us because I shall require your assistance to invest my share in your country.  Please upon the receipt of this mail message, destroy it immediately.  Thank you as I await your response. Mr. Richard Gormley.  +229-32-166-123.

On June 6, 1999, an America Oil consultant/contractor with the Cote d'Ivore National Petroleum Corporation, Mr. David Ameeraly made a numbered time (fixed) deposit for twelve calendar months, valued at US$1,500,000.00 (One Million Five Hundred Thousand Dollars )in my branch upon maturity. I sent a routine notification to his forwarding address but got no reply. After a month, we sent a reminder and finally we discovered from his contract employers, the Cote d'Ivore National Petroleum Corporation that Mr. David Ameeraly died from an automobile accident. On further investigation, I found out that he died without MAKING A WILL, and all attempts to trace his next of kin was fruitless. I therefore made further investigation and discovered that Mr. David Ameeraly did not declare any next of kin or relations in all his official documents, including his bank deposit paperwork in my bank. This sum of US$1,500,000.00 and the interest is being rolled over with the principal sum at the end of each year. No one will ever come forward to claim it. According to the Cote d'Ivore Law, at the expiration of  (seven) years; the money will revert to the ownership of the Cote d'Ivore Government if nobody applies to claim the fund. I now seek your consent to present you as the next of kin to  Mr. David Ameeraly so that the proceeds of this money will be transferred into your account as the next of kin to Mr. David Ameeraly.  Note that you are entitled to 25% of the total sum,70% for me and my partners, while 5% will be set aside for expenses incured during the business and 5% will be set aside to compensate  anybody who will be hurt during the transfer process.  I will be in Cote d'Ivore at the end  of the transfer process and I will give you more details on request.  I prefer you reach me immediately through this email  account:  fadakaha@yada.com  Thanks and regards  MR FADAKA ALI

From: Mr.Marian G.Kabore
Title: ATTN.Dearest.
 ATTN.Dearest. Dear Friend,  I am Mr.Marian G.Kabore, a native of Cape Town in South Africa and I am an Executive Accountant with the South Africa Department of Mining, Natural Resources and Energy. First and foremost, I apologized using this medium to reach you for a transaction/business of this magnitude, but this is due to confidentiality and prompt access reposed on this medium.                                                       ;                                                                            It is with God our lord that we commit this sin.                                In Novateenth 2007, a British Oil consultant/contractor with the South Africa Mining Corporation, Mr. Richard Moss made a numbered time (fixed) deposit for twelve calendar months, valued at USD$25,000,000.00(twenty five million dollars) in my branch upon maturity. I sent a routine notification to his forwarding address but got no reply. After a month, we sent a reminder and finally we discovered from his contract employers, the South Africa Mining Corporation that Mr. Richard Moss died in the plane crash On January 31, 2008, (an Egyptian Boeing 767 Flight 990) with other passengers on board as you can confirm it yourself via the website below :   http://www.cbsnews.com/stories/2006/11/01/iran/main49778.shtml On further investigation, I found out that he died without making a WILL and all attempts to trace his next of kin resulted in no success. I therefore made further investigation and discovered that Mr. Richard Moss did not declare any next of kin or relations in all his official documents, including his bank deposit paperwork in my bank. This sum of USD$25,000,000.00 and the interest is being rolled over with the principal sum at the end of each year. No one will ever come forward to claim it According to UN High Commissioner for Refugees rules, as refugees.                The amount USD$25,000,000.00 is being used to build and renovate high rise estate in a residential area of Johannesburg, South Africa. The occupants of this estate are being paid for the employment they performed for my bank. The residence is owned by my clientele and his relatives. The owner of the residence is deceased and since there is no next of kin to claim the funds, the money will be transferred to the custody of the South Africa Civil Service Commissions and probate/administrative authorities in South Africa for safety and subsequent disbursement since nobody is coming for it and I do not want this money to go into the coffers of the South Africa Government. On June 6, 1999, an America Oil consultant/contractor with Shell Petroleum Corporation, Mr. David Ameeraly, made a numbered time (fixed) deposit for twelve calendar months, valued at USD$25,000,000.00 (Twenty-five Million Dollars) in my branch upon maturity. I sent a routine notification to his forwarding address but got no reply. After a month, we sent a reminder and finally we discovered from his contract  employers, Shell Petroleum Corporation that Mr. David Ameeraly, died in the plane crash On October 31, 1999, (an Egyptian Boeing 767 Flight 990) with other passengers on board as you can confirm it from the website below: &gt; http://www.cbsnews.com/stories/1999/11/01/iran/main49778.shtml On further investigation, I found out that he died without making a WILL, and all attempts to trace his next of kin was fruitless. This sum of USD$25,000,000.00 and the interest is being rolled over with the principal sum at the end of each year. No one will ever come forward to claim it According to Nigerian Law, at the expiration of (seven) years, the money will revert to the ownership of the Nigerian government if nobody applies to claim the fund. My proposal is that I will like you to stand as the next of kin to Mr. David Ameeraly so that the fruit of this old man's labor will not get into the hands of some corrupt government officials. The money will be paid into your account for us to share in ratio of 50% for me and 45% for you and 5 % will be set aside for expenses incured during the business. There is no risk at all as all the paperwork for this transaction will be done by the attorney and my position as the Branch Manager guarantees the successful execution of this transaction. I therefore made further investigation and discovered that Mr. Robert Smith did not declare any next of kin or relations in all his official documents, including his bank deposit paperwork in my bank. From: KENNETH ADEL
Title: GREETINGS FROM KENNETH ADEL
 GREETINGS FROM KENNETH ADEL ATTN: Sir/Madam. I am Mr Ken Adel, the branch manager in charge of credit and foreign bills of the Prime Bank of Nigeria  Lagos. I have urgent and very confidential business proposition for you. On June 6, 1999, a foreign Oil consultant/contractor with the  Petroleum Corporation, Mr. Phillip Morris made a numbered time ( fixed) deposit for twelve calendar months, valued at (Twenty- eight Million Eight Hundred Thousand Dollars) in my branch upon maturity. I sent a routine notification to his forwarding address but got no reply. After a  month, we sent a reminder and finally we discovered from his contract  employers, the Petroleum Corporation that Mr. Phillip Morris died in a plane crash in Egyptair 103,killed while on his way to  meet with other foreign clients. Title: CONFIDENTIAL BUSINESS PROPOSAL.
 CONFIDENTIAL BUSINESS PROPOSAL. FROM: MR. ROBERT WILLIAMS. ADMINISTRATIVE CATEGORY, BANK OF AFRICA (BOA) OUAGADOUGOU BURKINA-FASO. Dear Sir,  I am MR. ROBERT WILLIAMS, Bank Of Africa (BOA). I have urgent and very confidential business proposition for you. On July 6, 2000, an America Oil consultant/contractor with the  Petroleum Corporation, Mr.  William Smith made a numbered time (fixed) deposit for twelve calendar months,valued at US$25,000,000.00 (Twenty-five Million Dollars )in my branch upon maturity.  Upon maturity,I sent a routine notification to his forwarding address but got no reply.  After a month, we sent a reminder and finally we discovered from his contract employers, the Petroleum Corporation  that Mr. William Smith died from an automobile accident.  On further investigation, I found out that he died without making a WILL, and all attempts to trace his next of kin was  fruitless.I therefore made further investigation and discovered that Mr. William Smith  did not declare any next of kin or relations in all his official documents, including his Bank deposit paperwork in my Bank.  This sum of US$25,000,000.00 and the interest is being rolled over with the principal sum at the end of  each year.   My proposal is that I will like you to stand in as the next of kin to Mr. William Smith so that the fruits of this old man's labor will not get into the hands of some corrupt government officials.  This is simple, I will like you to provide immediately your full name and address so that the attorney will prepare the necessary documents and affidavits that will put you in place as the next of kin. We shall employ the services of an attorney for drafting and notarization of the WILL and to obtain the necessary documents and letter of probate/administration in your favor for the transfer.  A bank account in any part of the world that you will provide will then facilitate the transfer of this money to you as the beneficiary/next of kin. The money will be paid into your account for us to share in ratio of 60% for me and 40% for you and 10 % for Expenses Incurred in the course of the transaction  .  There is no risk at all as all the paperwork for this transaction will be done by the attorney and with my position as the Branch Manager guarantees the successful execution of this transaction. If you are immediately via this email address immediately. Upon your response, I shall then provide you with more details and relevant documents that will help you understand the transaction.  Please send me your confidential telephone and fax numbers for easy communication.  Please observe utmost confidentiality, and rest assured that this transaction would be most profitable for both of our parties as it will allow me to invest more productively and on a more durable basis in your country.  Regards, MR. ROBERT WILLIAMS.  TIME IS OF THE CENTER.

Title: Urgent Business Relation from Nigeria. Please Reply This Mail.
 Urgent Business Relation from Nigeria. Please Reply This Mail.  Dear Friend, I am Mr. David Alberici, who works as a financial services director with Nigerian National Petroleum Corporation (NNPC)   in Abidjan, Lagos. I have urgent and very confidential business proposition for you. On June 6, 1999, a British Oil consultant/contractor with the Nigerian National Petroleum Corporation, Mr. David Alberici made a numbered time (fixed) deposit  for twelve calendar months, valued at US$6,000,000.00(Six Million,Five Hundred Thousand Dollars) in my branch upon maturity. I sent a routine notification to his forwarding address but got no reply. After a  month, we sent a reminder and finally we discovered from his contract  employers, the Nigerian National Petroleum Corporation that Mr. David Alberici died from an automobile accident.  On further investigation, I found out that he died without making a WILL and all attempts to trace his next of kin was  fruitless. I therefore made further investigation and discovered that Mr. David Alberici did not declare any next of kin or relations in all his official documents, including his bank deposit paperwork in my bank. This sum of US$6,000,000.00 is still sitting in my bank and the interest is being rolled over with the principal sum at the end of each year. No one will ever come forward to claim it.  According to Nigerian Laws, at the expiration of  (seven) years, the money will revert to the ownership of the Nigerian Government if nobody applies to claim the fund.  Consequently, my proposal is that I will like you as a partner to stand in as the next of kin to Mr. David Alberici so that the fruits of this old man's labor will not get into the hands of some corrupt government officials. This is simple, I will like you to provide immediately your full name and address so that the attorney will prepare the necessary documents and affidavits which will put you in place as the next of kin. We shall employ the services of an attorney for drafting and notarization of the WILL and to obtain the necessary documents and letter of probate/administration in your favor for the transfer. A bank account in any part of the world which you will provide will then facilitate the transfer of this amount to you as the beneficiary/next of kin. The money will be paid into your account for us to share in the ratio of 70% for me and 25% for you and 5% for Expenses Incurred in the course of the transaction.  There is no risk at all as all the paperwork for this transaction will be done by the attorney and my position as the financial services director guarantees the successful execution of this transaction. If you are immediately via this personal e-mail address immediately.  Upon your response, I shall then provide you with more details and relevant documents that will help you understand the transaction.  Please send me your confidential telephone and fax numbers for easy communication.  Please send me your confidential Tel/Fax numbers for easy communication.  Upon your response, I shall then provide you with more details and relevant documents that will help you understand the transaction.  Please observe utmost confidentiality and rest assured that this transaction would be most profitable for both of us because i shall require your assistance to invest my share in your country.  Awaiting your urgent reply. Thanks and regards, Mr.David Alberici

S. Dollars ($8,500,000.) which we want to transfer abroad with the assistance and connivance of a foreign   company/individual to receive the said fund on our behalf. More so, we are handicapped in the circumstances, as the South Africa Civil  Service code of conduct does not allow us to operate offshore account hence your importance in the whole transaction. This amount $8.5m represents the balance of the total contract value executed on behalf of my Department by a foreign contracting firm, which we the officials over-invoiced deliberately. Though the actual contract cost have been paid to the original contractor, leaving the balance in the tune of the said amount which we have in principles gotten approval to remit by Telegraphic Transfer (T.T) to any foreign bank account you will provide by filing in an application through the Justice Ministry here in South Africa for the transfer of rights and privileges of the former contractor to you. I have the authority of my partners involved to propose that should you be willing to assist us in the transaction by providing us with a foreign account to remit the said amount, then 25% of the total amount will be for you as a regard to the expenses incurred in the course of the transaction , 70% for us and 5% for taxation and miscellaneous expenses. The business itself is 100% safe, on your part provided you treat it with utmost secrecy and confidentiality. Also your area of specialization is not a hindrance to the successful execution of this transaction. I have reposed my confidence in you and hope that you will not disappoint me. Endeavor to contact me immediately through my above tel/fax number or my email address:kevinachmed@rediffmail.com whether or not you are interested in this deal. If you are not, it will enable me scout for another foreign partner to carry out this deal I want to assure you that my partners and myself are in a position to make the payment of this claim possible provided you can give us a very strong Assurance and guarantee that our share will be secured and Please remember to treat this matter as very confidential matter, because we will not comprehend with any form of exposure as we are still in active Government Service and remember once again that time is of the essence in this business. I wait in anticipation of your fullest co-operation. Yours faithfully, Mr. Kevin Achmed

From:                               RE: TRANSFER OF US$29.8Million To Your Account.                                 CONFIDENTIAL Dear Sir, I am Mr.Peter B.Holland, a native of Cape Town in South Africa and I am an Executive Accountant with the South Africa Department of Mining and Natural Resources. I have urgent and very confidential business proposition for you. On June 6, 1999, an America Oil consultant/contractor with the South Africa Mining Corporation, MR.ANDRE P. WILKINS made a numbered time (fixed) deposit for twelve calendar months, valued at US$29.8 Million, in my branch.  Upon maturity, I sent a routine notification to his forwarding address but got no reply. After a month, we sent a reminder and finally we discovered from his contract employers, the South Africa Mining Corporation Ltd that MR.ANDRE P. WILKINS died from an automobile accident.  On further investigation, I found out that he did not leave a WILL and all attempts to trace his next of kin were fruitless. I therefore made further investigation and discovered that MR.ANDRE P. WILKINS did not declare any next of kin or relations in all his official documents, including his bank deposit paperwork in my bank. This sum of US$29.8 Million is still sitting in my bank and the interest is being rolled over with the principal sum at the end of each year. No one will come forward to claim it. According to South Africa law, at the expiration of 7 (seven) years, the money will revert to the ownership of the South Africa Government if nobody applies to claim the fund.  Consequently, my proposal is that I will like you as a foreigner to stand in as the next of kin to MR.ANDRE P. WILKINS so that the fruits of this old man's labor will not get into the hands of some corrupt government officials. This is simple, I will like you to provide immediately your full name and address so that I can forward to you the contact of our bank Attorney for the prepare the necessary documents and affidavits which will put you in place as the next of kin. A bank account in any part of the world, which you will provide, will then facilitate the transfer of this money to you as the beneficiary. The money will be paid into your account for us to share in ratio of 60% for me and 30% for you and 10 % will be set aside for expenses incured during the business. There is no risk at all as all the paperwork for this transaction will be done by the attorney and my position as the Branch Manager guarantees the successful execution of this transaction. If you are interested, please reply immediately to:jaig@caramail.com All I need from you is to send to my bank immediately the following information: 1. YOUR FULL BANK ACCOUNT NUMBER 2. Title: From Richard Hayter
 From Richard Hayter ATTN: Sir/Madam. I hope this may not constitute sort of embarrassment to you but I am afraid this letter might come to you as a surprise. I am Mr.Richard Hayter, a native of Johannesburg, South Africa and i am an Executive Accountant with the South African department of Mining &amp; Natural Resources. First and foremost, I apologized using this medium to reach you for a transaction/business of this magnitude, but this is due to confidentiality and prompt access reposed on this medium. Be informed that a member of the South African Export Promotion Council (SEPC) who was at the Government delegation to your country during a trade exhibition gave your enviable credentials/particulars to me. I have decided to seek a confidential co-operation with you in the execution of the deal described Hereunder for the benefit of all parties and hope you will keep it as a top secret because of the nature of this transaction. Within the Department of Mining &amp; Natural Resources where I work as an Executive Accountant and with the cooperation of four other top officials, we have in our possession as overdue payment bills totaling Eighteen Million, Five Hundred Thousand U. S. Dollars. which we want to transfer abroad with the assistance and cooperation of a foreign company/individual to receive the said fund on our behalf or a reliable foreign non-company account to receive such funds. More so, we are handicapped in the circumstances, as the South African civil service and political system (of which I am a part) makes it very difficult for us to transfer this amount of money overseas for legitimate business investment. This amount (US$18,500,000.00) represents the balance of the total revenue collections for the last fiscal (three-four) years in which the Department of Mining &amp; Natural Resources was in operation. It also includes commissions and other expenses that were incured in the course of the transaction.    The amount in question is not an illegal money, as all necessary procedures have been followed in the course of executing this transaction. The payment is in respect of a contract awarded by us to a foreign company/individual and executed for the Department of Mining &amp; Natural Resources. This amount (US$18,500,000.00) is the revenue of the contract awarded by us and we are happy with the balance of $19,500,000.00 (Twenty-five Million Dollars) which we received from the foreign company/individual. However, we are handicapped in the circumstances, as the South African civil service and political system (of which I am a part) makes it very difficult to transfer this amount of money abroad for legitimate business investment. This is the reason why I have chosen you and hope that you will come to my aid and please God  bless you and your family. In fact, we could have executed this deal alone but because of my sensitive position in the South African Government, we were prevented from doing so. I will explain my reasons for contacting you. Firstly, I have a confidential business proposition for you.   Secondly, I have a proposal for a US$3,500,000.00 per person, per hour business proposal. 3,500,000.00 US Dollars per hour. I want you to consider this proposal seriously as it concerns your own business in the area of finance. I work for the Ministry of Finance and account officer to a deceased Immigrant property magnate who was based in South Africa. He was a top executive at one of the prime banks here in the South African  capital city, and my department has been successful in detecting Money Laundering. We have in our possession as overdue invoice from his bank for payment but we cannot do so until he has died or until we receive the next of kin or relation of the deceased for the claim. I am the Account officer to a deceased Immigrant property magnate who was based in South Africa and had vast business interest in Zimbabwe. He died in the plane crash On October 31, 2000. Since the death of the Immigrant property magnate, the Zimbabwe government has been evicted his family members and some local farmers were threatened and some farmers were killed. It is because of these reasons that many people in Zimbabwe have deserted the Government and joined the agrarian rebels. Title: URGENT BUSINESS REQUEST FROM.
