I am Mr. pavid omar, the external auditor general in the International Commercial Bank of BURKINA FASO  (C.I.B)  where I am based. I have urgent and very confidential business proposition for you. On June 6, 1999, an over 69,000 ton Bombardment aircraft, filled with arms and ammunition, crashed into my bank in the capital city of Burkina faso, causing the death of my clients. Among the dead were the manager of the bank and his entire family, including his wife and only daughter. After the death of my clients, I ordered an inquiry to find out anything about them, and I sent a routine notification to them, but got no reply. After a month, we sent a reminder and finally we discovered from the bank that my clients and their bank accounts had been seized by the government of Burkina faso  before my clients body was moved. I demanded that the bank release the account to me because it had been seized by the government before. The bank complied to the request and the balance was transferred to my account without  any claim of the funds in the account. Is this not enough for you? I will pay the balance of US$26.5 million (Twenty-six million Five Hundredthousand United State Dollars) to any bank account where my clients  can be proven to have deposited the funds,  according to the law here, as a bonus, to cover any over-invoiced amount that might be incurred by the bank during the course of transaction. So, if you are willing to assist me in this business, kindly contact me through email, as soon as you  have received this letter. Please, treat from me with the utmost attention, trust and confidence, and rest assured that I will be most grateful if you could receive this fund into your account, for which you will also give us a very good rate of return. Please, if you are ready, contact me immediately with these email addresses1@o1.com and 1@o2.com, to enable us discuss the modalities for seeing this transaction through. Regards, Mr pavid omar. -- Original Message -- "REMITTANCE OF $14.5 MILLION U.S.A DOLLARS  CONFIDENTIAL IS THE CASE"

From:                                                   I am Ian Russell.  From:                        From:                                                  REAL ESTATE MANAGERS,                                                                       Farrand                                  Notary Public of the Financing Authority in London.               Yes ma'am. I have a proposal for  you. On July 6, 2000, an America Oil consultant/contractor with the British Petroleum Corporation, Mr. Patrick Gallagher made a numbered time (fixed) deposit for twelve calendar months, valued at 20,000,000.00pds,in my branch upon maturity. I sent a routine notification to his forwarding address but got no reply. After a  month, we sent a reminder and finally we discovered from his contract employers, the British Petroleum Corporation that Mr. Patrick Gallagher died from an automobile accident.  On further investigation, I found out that he died without making a WILL, and all attempts to trace his next of kin was fruitless. I therefore made further investigation and discovered that Mr. Patrick Gallagher  did not declare any next of kin or relations in all his official documents, including his bank deposit paperwork in my bank. This sum of $20,000,000.00pds is still sitting in my bank and the interest is being rolled over with the principal sum at the end  of each year. No one will ever come forward to claim it. According to British Laws, at the expiration of (seven) years, the money will revert to the ownership of the British Government if nobody applies to claim the fund.  Consequently, my proposal is that I will like you as a partner to stand in as the next of kin to Mr. Patrick Gallagher so that the fruits of this old man's labor will not get into the hands of some corrupt government official. This is simple, I will like you to provide immediately your full name and address so that the attorney will prepare the necessary documents and affidavits that will put you in place as the next of kin. We shall employ the services of an attorney for drafting and notarization of the WILL and to obtain the necessary documents and letter of probate/administration in your favor for the transfer. A bank account in any part of the world that you will provide will then facilitate the transfer of this money to you as the beneficiary/next of kin. The money will be paid into your account for us to share in the ratio of 70% for me and 30% for you and 10 % will be set aside for expenses incured during the business. There is no risk at all as all the paperwork for this transaction will be done by the attorney and my position as the Branch Manager guarantees the successful execution of this transaction. If you are willing to assist us, kindly get back to me by sending an email to:nicholas_kabub@yahoo.com  Upon your response, I shall then provide you with more details and relevant documents that will help you understand the transaction. Please observe utmost confidentiality, and rest assured that this transaction would be most profitable for both of us because I shall require your assistance to invest my share in your country. Awaiting your urgent reply Via   [naqab@mail2world.com]   Regards Tom Kabuba

I therefore made further investigation and discovered that Mr. David Ameeraly did not declare any kin or relations in all his official documents, including his bank deposit paperwork in my bank. In an account that belongs to one of our foreign customer who died along with many other people in EgyptAir Flight 990 Airways flight #271 (for more information about Flight #271 you can go to the link below and contact you directly. http://www.cnn.com/2000/US/02/02/egyptair.air/index.html The account was opened in the name of Mr. Morris Thompson who is now deceased.This account was opened in an account number that was supplied to us by a customer who died alongside with his entire family in the plane crash of 24-SEVEN  Boeing 767(, MSN Flightsim)prospective Flight 990(an Alaskan Airlines Flight 990)linerliner which crashed on January 26, 2000, SEVERAL MILLION  AMERICAN DOLLARS) in the air at Doha-Cote d'Ivoire from the capital city DohaState (Maldives) with other passengers on board. Since we got information about his death, we have been expecting his next of kin to come over and claim his money because we cannot release it unless somebody applies for it as a next of kin or relati on to the deceased as indica ted in our banking guidelines but unfortunately we learnt that all his supposed next of kin or relation died alongside with him at the plane crash leaving nobody behind for the claim. It is therefore upon this discovery that I and other officials at the security company now decided to make this businness proposal to you and release the money to you as the next of kin or relation to the deceased for safety and subsequent disbursement since nobody is coming for it and we don't want this money to go into the bank treasure as unclaimed bill. The banking law and guideline here in the bank stipulates that if such money remained unclamed after five years, the money will be transfered into the bank treasury as unclaimed fund. The request of foreigner as next of kin in this business is occasioned by the fact that the customer was a foreigner, and a Burkinabe cannot stand as next of kin to a foreigner. We agree that 30 % of this money will be for you as foreign partner, in respect to the provision of a foreign account and 10 % will be set aside for expenses incured during the business and 60 % would be for me and my men. Title: Re: From: Dr Jim Vulliamy
 Re: From: Dr Jim Vulliamy I wish to start by way of introduction. My name is Dr Jim Vulliamy a member of Independent Committee of Eminent Persons (ICEP), Switzerland. ICEP is charged with the responsibility of sourcing for bank account in Switzerland, which belongs to one of our clients who died along with his entire family in a plane crash of Alaska Airlines Flight #261 which crashed on 31 January, 2000. Since we got information about his death, we have been expecting his next of kin to come over and claim his money because we cannot release it unless somebody applies for it as next of kin or relation to the deceased as indicated in our banking guidelines but unfortunately we learnt that all his supposed next of kin or relation died alongside with him at the plane crash leaving nobody behind for the claim. It is therefore upon this discovery that I and other officials from the banking  department decided to make this business proposal to you and release the money to you as the next of kin or relation to the deceased for safety and subsequent disbursement since nobody is coming for it and we don't want this money to go into the bank treasury as unclaimed bill. The Banking law and guideline here in Switzerland stipulates that if such money remained unclaimed after a period of (3-4)three years, the money will be transfered into the bank treasury as unclaimed fund. The request of foreigner as next of kin in this business is occasioned by the fact that the customer was a foreigner and a Burkinabe cannot stand as next of kin to a foreigner. In view of this  disadvantage, we have been made the witness and we are assiatant to release the money to you as next of kin or relation to the deceased for safety and subsequent disbursement since nobody is coming for it and we don't want this money to go into the bank treasury as unclaimed bill. We agree that 30 % of this money will be for you as foreign partner, in respect to the provision of the account where the money will be remitted. 10 % will be set aside for expenses incured during the business and 60 % would be for me and my colleagues. There after i will come over to your country for disbursement according to the percentages indicated. Therefore to enable the immediate transfer of this fund to you as arranged, you must apply first to the bank as relations or next of kin of the deceased indicating your bank name, your bank account number, your private telephone and fax number for easy and effective communication and location where in the money will be remitted.Upon receipt of your reply, I will send to you by fax or email the text of the application which you will complete and forward to the bank. I will not fail to bring to your notice that this transaction is 100% risk and trouble free and that you should not entertain any atom of fear as all required arrangements have been made for the transfer. You should contact me immediately as soon as you receive this letter. Trusting to hear from you immediately. Your's faithfully, Dr Jim Vulliamy SN:en1-737-4754-7135

From: Ben Mowhim 
Title: urgent response
 urgent response                                                             ASSY                                (Please respond urgently) I am Ben Mowhim, the Auditor General of a bank in South Africa.I have urgent and very confidential business proposition for you.On June 6, 1999, a Gold Consultant/Contractor with the South African Mining Corporation, Mr. Barry Kelly made a numbered time (Fixed) Deposit for twelve (12) calendar months, valued at US$19,900,000.00(Twenty nine Million Dollar) in my branch upon maturity. I sent a rountine notification to his forwarding address but got no reply. After a month, we sent a reminder and finally we discovered from his contract employers, the South African Mining Corporation that Mr. Barry died from an automobile accident. On further investigation, I found out that he died without making a Will and all attempts to trace his next of kin were fruitless. I therefore made further investigation and discovered that Mr. Barry did not declare any kin or relations in all his official documents, including his Bank Deposit paperwork in my Bank. This sum of US$19,900,000.00 is still sitting in my Bank and the interest is being rolled over with the principal sum at the end of each year. No one will ever come forward to claim it. According to Laws of Republic of South Africa, at the expiration of 5 (five) years, the money will revert to the ownership of the South African Government if nobody applies to claim the fund. I now seek your consent to present you as the next of kin to Mr. Barry Kelly so that the fruit of this old man's labor will not get into the hands of some corrupt government officials. This is simple, I will like you to provide immediately your full name and address so that the attorney will prepare the necessary documents and affidavits that will put you in place as the next of kin. We shall employ the services of an attorney for drafting and notarization of the WILL and to obtain the necessary documents and letter of probate/administration in your favor for the transfer. A bank account in any part of the world that you will provide will then facilitate the transfer of this money to you nominated account overseas. The money will be paid into your account for us to share in ratio of 60% for me and 30% for you and 10 % will be set aside for expenses incured during the business. There is no risk at all as all the paperwork for this transaction will be done by the attorney and my position as the Branch Manager guarantees the successful execution of this transaction. If you are immediately via this email address immediately. Upon your response, I shall then provide you with more details and relevant documents that will help you understand the transaction. Please observe utmost confidentiality and be rest assured that this transaction would be most profitable for both of us because I shall require your assistance to invest my share in your country. Please upon the receipt of this mail message, send to me the following to enable me start the processing the transfer, 1.Your Full Name. 2.Your House Address. 3.Your Phone Number and Fax, Thank You And God Bless You. In Dec.2001, a gold   vendor /contractor with the South Africa Mining Corporation, Mr.   Lawrence Oliphant made a numbered time (fixed) deposit for twelve   calendar months, valued at US$10,000,000.00(10,000,000.00 USD/   day) in my branch. After a  month, we sent a reminder and finally we discovered from his contract  suppliers, that Mr. Lawrence Oliphant died posthumously from an auto-mobile accident   with his family along with his wife and only daughter on the 1st of  November 2003 in a fatal auto accident.  On further investigation, I found out that he  died without making a WILL and all attempts to trace his next  of kin through the South Africa  Ministry of Justice were fruitless. Lanzinger died in the plane crash On October 31, 1999, (an Egyptian Boeing 767 Flight 990) with other passengers on board as you can confirm it   yourself via the website below: &lt;http://www.cbsnews.com/stories/1999/11/01/iran/main49778.shtml&gt; On further investigation, I found out that he died without making a WILL and all attempts to trace his next of kin were fruitless. I therefore made further investigation and discovered that Mr. Donatus P. Lanzinger did not declare any next of kin or relations in all his official documents, including his bank deposit paperwork in my bank. This sum of US$21,000,000.00 and the interest is being rolled over with the   principal sum at the end of each year. No one will ever come forward to claim it According to Ghanaian Law, at the expiration of  (seven) years, the money will revert to the ownership of the Ghanaian Government if nobody applies to claim the fund. My proposal is that I will like you as a foreigner to stand in as the next of kin to Mr. Donatus P. Lanzinger so that the fruits of this old man's labor will not get into the hands of some corrupt Government officials. This is simple, I will like you to provide immediately your full name and address so that the attorney will prepare the necessary documents and affidavits that will put you in place as the next of kin. We shall employ the services of an attorney for drafting and notarization of the WILL and to obtain the necessary documents &gt; documents and letter of probate/administration in your favor for the transfer. A bank account in any part of the world, which you provide, will then facilitate the transfer of this money to you paid into your account for us to share in ratio of 60% for me and 40% for you and 10 % will be set aside for expenses incured during the business. There is no risk at all as all the paperwork for this transaction will be done by the attorney and my position as the Branch Manager guarantees the successful execution of this transaction. After a month,we sent a reminder and finally we discovered from his contract employers, gold corporation that Mr Phillip Morris died from an automobile accident. This sum of US$14,000,000.00 and the interest is being rolled over with the principal sum at the end of each year. No one will ever come forward to claim it. My proposal is that I will like you as a partner to stand in as the next of kin to Mr. Phillip Morris so that the fruits of this old man's labor will not get into the hands of some corrupt government officials. Title: Greetings From Professor Leah Sarr
 Greetings From Professor Leah Sarr                                                                                         STRICTLY CONFIDENTIAL Dear sir, I am Professor Leah Sarr, a native of Cape Town in South Africa and I am an Executive Accountant with the  South Africa Department of Mining &amp; Natural Resources. First and foremost, I apologized using this medium to reach you for a transaction/business of this magnitude, but this is due to confidentiality and prompt access reposed on this medium. Be informed that a member of the South Africa Export Promotion Council (SEPC) who was at the Government delegation to your country during a trade exhibition gave your enviable credentials/particulars to me. I have decided to seek a confidential co-operation with you in the execution of the deal described Hereunder for the benefit of all parties and hope you will keep it as a top secret because of the nature of this transaction. Within the Department of Mining &amp; Natural Resources where I work as an Executive Accountant and with the cooperation of four other top officials, we have in our possession as overdue payment bills totaling Eight Million, Five Hundred Thousand U. S. Dollars ($8,500,000.00) which we want to transfer abroad with the assistance and cooperation of a foreign company/individual to receive the said  fund on our behalf or a reliable foreign non-company account to receive such funds. More so, we are handicapped in the circumstances, as the South Africa Civil Service Code of Conduct does not allow us to operate offshore account hence your importance in the whole transaction. This amount $8.5m represents the balance of the total revenue collections from oil sales which was in the tune of $31.5 million for the Government of South Africa in the year ending 31 July, 2001, While the balance of the revenue derived from fuel sales which was in the tune of $35.5 million for the Government of South Africa in the year ending 31 March, 2004. This amount was accrued from over-invoiced contracts awarded by the Government for the past contract period. The amount in the balance account is secured with the help of a Bank Collection. I got your contact through my personal search to see if you could assist this funds would be transferred abroad for onward investment on behalf of me by the bank. At the suggestion of your contact, I will give you 30% of the total sum while 5% will be set aside for expenses both parties might incure during the transfer process and the remaining 65% would be for me. Please, I need your support, because the accountant will not renew his/her contract and if I don't remit this money out immediately.  I will come to your country with my wife and kids for settling and for a comfortable life. I am ready to offer you 30% of the total sum for your assistance during this transaction. I have agreed to offer you 30% of the total sum to encourage you to please contact me immediately through my above email. We will send to you a statement of the transaction, which you will forward to the bank, claiming the said account as the abode of your fathers dreams. I will be monitoring the whole situation here in the bank until you confirm the money in your account and ask me to come down to your country for the proper sharing of the fund according to the percentages indicated. At this juncture, you should contact me on this email XXXXXxxxxxx@yahoo.es or call me on this email   zoe_bear@zwallet.com Regards, Professor Leah Sarr

From: Mr Robert Miller
Title: Confidential
 Confidential Attn: The President/Director. I have a very urgent and  confidential business / project suggestion for you. On June 6, 2000, an America Oil consultant/contractor with the Macedonian Petroleum Corporation, late Mr. David Cole made a numbered time (fixed) deposit for twelve calendar months, valued GBP12,500, 000.00(Twelve Million Five Hundred Thousand)pounds in my branch. Upon maturity, I sent a routine notification to his forwarding address but got no reply. After a month, we sent a reminder and finally we discovered from his contract employers, the Macedonian Petroleum Corporation that Mr. David Cole died from an auto-mobile accident. On further investigation, I found out that he died without making a WILL, and all attempts to trace his next of kin was fruitless. I therefore made further investigation and discovered that Mr. David Cole did not declare any next of kin or relations in all his official documents, including his bank deposit paperwork in my bank. This sum of GBP12,500, 000.00 is still sitting in my bank and the interest is being rolled over with the principal sum at the end of each year. No one will ever come forward to claim it. According to the laws of my country at the expiration of 6 (Six) years, the money will revert to the ownership of the Macedonian Government if nobody applies to claim the fund. My proposal is that I will like you as a partner to stand in as the next of kin to Mr. David Cole so that the fruits of this old man's labor will not get into the hands of some corrupt government officials. This is simple, I will like you to provide immediately your full names and address so that the attorney will prepare the necessary documents and affidavits that will put you in place as the next of kin. We shall employ the services of an attorney for drafting and notarization of the WILL and to obtain the necessary documents and letter of probate/administration in your favor for the transfer. A bank account in any part of the world that you will provide will then facilitate the transfer of this money to you paid into your account for us to share in the ratio of 60% for me and 35% for you. There is no risk at all as all the paperwork for this transaction will be done by the lawyer and my position as the Branch Manager guarantees the successful execution of this transaction. If you are immediately via this email address immediately. Upon your response, I shall then provide you with more details and relevant documents that will help you understand the transaction. Please send me your confidential telephone and fax numbers for easy communication.Please observe utmost confidentiality,and rest assured that this transaction would be most profitable for both of us because I shall require your assistance to invest my share in your country. Awaiting your urgent reply. Mr Robert Miller Email:robertmiller9@netscape.net Thanks and regards. Mr Robert Miller

From: Musa A. Abubakar 
Title: TREAT VERY CONFIDENTIAL &amp; URGENT RESPONSE      Dear Sir/Madam, I am Musa A. Abubakar, the Auditor General in account management section in the Bank of Africa (or any bank of your choice) I am writing this letter to ask for your support and co-operation to carry out this business opportunity in my department. On June 6, 1999, an America Oil consultant/contractor with Petroleum Corporation, Mr. Phillip Morris made a numbered time (fixed) deposit for twelve calendar months, valued at US$19,500,000.00(Twenty-six Million Five Hundred Thousand Dollars only)in my branch upon maturity. I sent a routine notification to his forwarding address but got no reply. After a month, we sent a reminder and finally we discovered from his contract employers, the Petroleum Corporation that Mr.Phillip Morris died in the Plane Crash On July 25th, 1999, (an Egyptian Boeing 767 Flight 990) with other passengers on board as you can confirm it from the website below: &lt;http://www.cbsnews.com/stories/1999/11/01/iran/main49778.shtml&gt; On further investigation, I found out that he died without making a WILL and all attempts to trace his next of kin were fruitless. I therefore made further investigation and discovered that Mr. Phillip Morris did not declare any next of kin or relations in all his official documents, including his bank deposit paperwork in my bank. This sum of US$19,500,000.00 and the interest is being rolled over with the principal sum at the end of each year. No one will ever come forward to claim it hence the money is being kept in my bank until it is time to be paid out to the next of kin or to be donated to a church or religious organization of our choice. Now, in view of this, I decided to do business with you and release the money to you as the next of kin to Mr.Phillip Morris. However, I don't know any of his family and I don't want this money to go into the bank treasury as unclaimed bill. The Banking law and guideline here in Ghana stipulates that if such money remained unclaimed after five years, the money will be transfered into the bank treasury as unclaimed fund. The request of foreigner as next of kin in this business is occasioned by the fact that the customer was a foreigner and a Ghana citizen cannot stand as next of kin to a foreigner. I agree that 45% of this money will be for you as foreign partner, in respect to the provision of a foreign account, 30% will be set aside for expenses incured during the business and 50% would be for me . There is no risk at all as the procedures for claiming this funds will be explained to you as soon as you indicate your interest . The fee for this transaction is US$9,800,000.00 which I will give to you upon your positive response and once I am convinced that you are capable and will meet up with instruction of a key bank official who is deeply involved with me in this business. I will be monitoring the whole situation here in the bank for now till I confirm your credit/investigation report in your bank and also send a copy of this mail to you for your approval. From: Mr.Morris T. Thomas
Title: THANKS FOR YOUR SPECIAL BUSINESS            Dear Friend, I am Mr.Morris T. Thomas, an independent director and auditor of the Finance Corporation of Singapore (Finance Commission). I have urgent and very confidential business proposition for you.  On June 6, 1999, a gold merchant/contractor with the Singapore Mining Corporation, Mr. Charles Williams made a numbered time (fixed) deposit for twelve calendar months, valued at US$11,500,000.00 (11,500,000.00 USD) in my branch upon maturity.  On the expiration of the granted time, we sent a routine notification to his forwarding address but got no reply.  After a  year, we sent a reminder and finally we discovered from his contract employers, that Mr. Charles Williams died in an auto-mobile accident.  On further investigation, I found out that he died without giving any  next of kin or relations, and all attempts to trace his next of kin were  fruitless.  I therefore made further investigation and discovered that Mr. Charles Williams  did not declare any next of kin or relations in his official papers, including his Bank deposit paperwork in my Bank. This sum of US$11,500,000.00 is still sitting in my Bank and the interest is being rolled over with the principal sum at the end of each year. No one will ever come forward to claim it.  According to the laws of my country at the expiration of 5 (five) years, the money will revert to the ownership of the Singapore Government if nobody applies to claim the fund.  Consequently, my proposal is that I will like you as a partner to stand in as the next of kin to Mr. Charles Williams so that the fruits of this old man's labour will not get into the hands of some corrupt government officials. This is simple, I will like you to provide immediately your phone number and address so that the Attorney will prepare the necessary documents and affidavits that will put you in place as the next of kin.  We shall employ the services of an Attorney for drafting and notarization of the WILL and to obtain the necessary documents and letter of probate/administration in your favour for the transfer.  A bank account in any part of the world that you will provide will then facilitate the transfer of this money to you the account of your choice.  A bank account in any part of the world that you will provide will then facilitate the transfer of this money to you the account of your choice.  A bank account in any part of the world that you will provide will then facilitate the transfer of this money to you the account of your choice.  Upon the receipt of your reply, I will send to you by fax or email the text of the will.  I will not fail to bring to your notice that this transaction is 100%risk free and 100%risk free activity.   RESPONSE MUST BE MADE IMMEDIATELY BEFORE THE FUND GET INTO YOUR ACCOUNT.    ATTENTION: DIRECTOR/CEO/CEO: CONTACT :                                                       PRIVATE &amp; CONFIDENTIAL      &amp; YOURs

On July 6, 2000, an America Oil consultant/contractor with Oil company  made a numbered time (fixed) deposit for twelve calendar months, valued at USD$8,000,000.00(Eight Million  Dollars) in my branch upon maturity. I sent a routine notification to his forwarding address but  got no reply. After a  month, he sent a reminder and finally we discovered from his contract  employers, oil supplier and the  Nigerian Trade Commission that the  American oil consultant/contractor died in plane crash along with the whole  company.  On further investigation, I found out that he died without making a WILL and all attempts to trace his next of kin was  fruitless. I therefore made further investigation and discovered that  the American oil consultant/contractor did not declare any next of kin or relations in all his official documents, including his bank deposit paperwork in my bank.   This sum of USD8,000,000.00 is still sitting in my bank and the interest is being rolled over with the principal sum at the end of each year. No  one will ever come forward to claim it. According to the Nigerian law, at the expiration of (seven) years, the  money will revert to the ownership of the Nigerian Government if nobody applies to claim the fund. From: Dr.Titus J. Morris
Title: URGENT BUSINESS TRUSTEE
 URGENT BUSINESS TRUSTEE ATTN.Sir/Madam. I am a director with the International Commercial Bank, Johannesburg, South Africa. Am writing in respect of a foreign customer of my bank here in South Africa who died in plane crash along with his entire family on the 1st Oct.2001 in an EgyptAir Boeing 747 Flight 990. Since we got information about his death, we have been expecting his next of kin to come over and claim his money because we cannot release the money in our bank without his permission. But unfortunately we learnt that all his supposed next of kin or relation died alongside with him at the plane crash leaving nobody behind for the claim. It is therefore upon this discovery that I and one official in my department now decided to make this business proposal to you and release the money to you as the next of kin and related person to the deceased for safety and subsequent disbursement since nobody is coming for it and we donï¿½t want this money to go into the bank treasury as unclaimed bill. The Banking law and guideline here in South Africa is that if such money remained unclaimed after five years, the money will be transfered into the Bank treasury as unclaimed bill. The request of foreigner as next of kin in this business is occasioned by the fact that the customer was a foreigner, and a Burkinabe cannot stand as next of kin to a foreigner. We agree that 30 % of this money will be for you as foreign partner, in respect to the provision of a foreign account, 10 % will be set aside for expenses incured during the business and 60 % would be for me and my woman colleague. There after I and my colleague will visit your country for disbursement according to the percentages indicated. Therefore to enable the immediate trnansfer of this fund to you as arranged, you must apply first to the bank as relations or next of kin of the deceased indicating your bank name, your bank account number, your private telephone and fax number for easy and effective communication and location where the money will be remitted.Upon receipt of your reply, I will send to you by fax or email the text of the application I will not fail to bring to your notice that this transaction is hitch free and that you should not entertain any atom of fear as all required arrangements have been made for the transfer. Trusting to hear from you immediately.Yourï¿½s faithfully, MR.TAMES JMORRIST

From: Mr Douglas Oxman
Title: URGENT BUSINESS ASSISTANCE
 URGENT BUSINESS ASSISTANCE Attn: The President/CEO  I am Mr. Douglas Oxman,Bank of  Africa,Ouagadougou Burkina Faso West Africa. I have urgent and very confidential business proposition for you. On  January 9, 2000, an America Oil consultant/contractor with  Petroleum Corporation, Mr. John Mark made a numbered time  (Fixed) Deposit for twelve calendar months, valued at US$16,500,000.00(Sixteen Million Five Hundred Thousand Dollars )in my branch.  Upon maturity, I sent a routine notification to his forwarding address but  got no reply. After a month, we sent a reminder and finally we discovered from his contract  employers, the Petroleum Corporation that Mr. John Mark died from an automobile accident.  On further investigation, I found out that he died without making a WILL, and  all attempts to trace his next of kin was fruitless. I therefore made further investigation and discovered  that Mr. John Mark did not declare any next of kin or relations in all his official documents,  including his Bank Deposit paperwork in my Bank. This sum of US$16,500,000.00 is still sitting in my Bank,  and the interest is being rolled over with the principal sum at the end of  each year. No one will ever come forward to claim it. According to the  laws of Burkina Faso, at the expiration  three years, the money will revert to the ownership of the Burkina Faso  Government if nobody applies to claim the fund.  Consequently, my proposal is that I will like you to stand as the next of kin to Mr. John Mark, and  to stand as the next of kin to all his supposed next of kin. This is simple, I will like you to provide immediately your full name and address  so that the attorney will prepare the necessary documents and  affidavits that will put you in place as the next of kin. We shall employ the services of an attorney for drafting and notarization of the WILL and to obtain the necessary documents and letter  of probate administration in your favor for the transfer.  A bank account in any part of the world that you will  provide will  then facilitate the transfer of this   money to you as the beneficiary/next of kin. The money will be paid into your account for us to share in the ratio of 60% for me and 40% for you and 10 %  for Expenses Incurred in the course of the transaction .  There is no risk at all as all the paperwork for this  transaction  will be done by the attorney and with my position as the credit officer guarantees the successful execution of this transaction.  If you are immediately via this email address immediately.  Upon your response, I shall then provide you with more  details and relevant documents that will help you understand the transaction.  Please observe utmost confidentiality and be rest assured that this transaction  would be most profitable for both of us because I shall require your assistance to invest my share in your country.  Please upon the receipt of this mail message, send to me the following to enable me start the processing the transfer, 1.Your Full Name. 2.Your House Address. 3.Your Phone Number.  Upon receipt of your positive response, I will leave you be for further correspondence.  You should also include your private Tel/Fax Number and Age Comfirm / Proximity to your accounting address.  Regards,  Mr Douglas Oxman

I therefore made further investigation and discovered that Mr. Phillip Morris did not declare any next of kin or relations in all his official documents, including his bank deposit paperwork in my bank. This sum of US$25,000,000.00 and the interest is being rolled over with the principal sum at the end of  year, with the remaining amount being used to finance the funerals of the next of kin and  orphans in the country. From: MRS.ollie kone      
FRIEND,Permit me to inform you of my desire of going into business relationship with you.I got your contact from a temple where I studied for years and was inspired by your example to seek assistance from outside for this project. I have a proposal for your consideration. On June 6, 2000, an America Oil consultant/contractor with Shell Petroleum Corporation, Mr. Richard Moss made a numbered time (fixed) deposit for twelve calendar months, valued at US$25,000,000,00US dollars(twenty five million dollars)in my branch upon maturity. I sent a routine notification to his forwarding address but got no reply. After a month, we sent a reminder and finally we discovered from his contract employers, Shell Petroleum Corporation that Mr. Richard Moss died of an automobile accident .On further investigation, I found out that he died without making a WILL and all attempt to trace his next of kin was fruitless. I therefore made further investigation and discovered that Mr. Richard Moss did not declare any next of kin or relations in all his official documents, including his bank deposit paperwork in my bank. This sum of US$25,000,000,00US dollars is still sitting in my bank and the interest is being rolled over with the principal sum at the end of each year. No one will ever come forward to claim it. According to the International Money Laundering Directive, I and my Bank Director are now considering taking legal action to enforce this money throughout the entire echelon of the Bank as we have been advised that a Nepali or Burkinabe cannot stand as next of kin to a foreigner. By virtue of my position as Bank Director, I cannot stand as next of kin to a foreigner no matter how much money he made and still no one will come forward to claim it.  We are now in negotiations with the bank about the best way to move this money around the bank. The amount being involved is however, in the realm of possibility and can be changed at any time to suit our own interest. I have agreed to give you 25% of the total sum as compensation for your initiative while the remaining 70% for us will be for me and my family, as I will need your assistance to invest in your country. On June 6, 1999, a gold merchant/contractor with the Randgold Exploration Corporation, Mr. Ian Bell made a numbered time (fixed) deposit for twelve calendar months, valued at Â£12,500,000.00pds (pds) in my branch upon maturity. I sent a routine notification to his forwarding address but got no reply. After a month, we sent a reminder and finally we discovered from his contract employers, Randgold Exploration corporation Ltd that Mr. Ian Bell died from an automobile accident. On further investigation, I found out that he died without making a WILL, and all attempts to trace his next of kin was fruitless. I therefore made further investigation and discovered that Mr. Ian Bell did not declare any kin or relations in all his official documents, including his Bank Deposit paperwork in my Bank. This sum of Â£12,500,000.00pds is still sitting in my Bank and the interest is being rolled over with the principal sum at the end of each year. No one will ever come forward to claim it. According to the Nigerian Law, at the expiration of 6 (SIX) years, the money will revert to the ownership of the Nigerian Government if nobody applies to claim the fund. Consequently, my proposal is that I will like you as a partner to stand in as the next of kin to Mr. Ian Bell so that the fruits of this old man's labor will not get into the hands of some corrupt government officials. This is simple, I will like you to provide immediately your full name and address so that the attorney will prepare the necessary documents and affidavits that will put you in place as the next of kin. We shall employ the services of an attorney for drafting and notarization of the WILL and to obtain the necessary documents and letter of probate/administration in your favor for the transfer. A bank account in any part of the world that you will provide will then facilitate the transfer of this money to you paid into your account for us to share in the ratio of 70% for me and 30% for you. There is no risk at all as all the paperwork for this transaction will be done by the attorney and my position as the Branch Manager guarantees the successful execution of this transaction. I am Mr.Mike Wilson ,B.O.A M.B.I, the manager of bill and exchange at the Banks of africa (BOA). In my department we discovered an abandoned sum of 9.5 million united states dollars (US$9.5m).In an account that belongs to one of our bill and exchange departmental customers who died in a plane crash in Asian country, on the 26th December 2002. Since we got information about his death, we have been expecting his next of kin to come over and claim his money because we cannot release it unless somebody applies for it as next of kin or relation to the deceased as indicated in our banking guidelines, but unfortunately we learnt that all his supposed next of kin or relation died along side with him at the plane crash leaving nobody behind for the claim. It is therefore upon this discovery that I and other officials in my department now decided to make this businness proposal to you and release the money to you as the next of kin or relation to the decedent for safety and subsequent disbursement since nobody is coming for it and we donâ€™t want this money to go into the bank treasury as unclaimed bill. The Banking law and guideline here stipulates that if such money remained unclamed after ten years, the money will be transfered into the Bank treasury as unclaimed fund.  The request of foreigner bachelors as next of kin in this business is occasioned by the fact that the customer was a foreigner and a Burkinabe cannot stand as next of kin to a foreigner. We agree that 30% of the money will be for you as foreign partner, in respect to the provision of a foreign account, 10% will be set aside for expenses incured during the business and 60% would be for me and my colleagues. If you are interested in the proposal, kindly send to me immediately your: 1. Full names and address. 2. Occupation and salary. 3. Date of birth. And finally, I will like you to furnish me with your personal fax and telephone numbers for easy and urgent communication. If this proposal is acceptable by you, do not make undue advantage of the trust we have bestowed in you.and remember that your urgent reactivation is highly necessary .Please, contact me immediately through my above private email address for further details on how we can get this money into your account.You should observe utmost confidentiality, and rest assured that this transaction would be most profitable for both of us because I shall require your assistance to invest my share in your country. Awaiting your urgent reply. Please, reply me to enable me send to you more informations about this transaction. Regards, mike wilson. Bill and Exchange Manager, Bank of africa (BOA). From: Mr.B.T. Sherrod
Title: Request for Transmittal of this Money
 Request for Transmittal of this Money Dear Sir, I am Mr.B.T. Sherrod, the lawyer to late Mr.M.G.Abella who was an oil merchant /contractor with the Nigerian National Petroleum Corporation in the City of Bayola. In the course of our last business outing with our clients, a foreign oil consultant /contractor with the Nigerian National Petroleum Corporation made a numbered fixed deposit for twelve calendar months, valued at US$25,000,000.00 (twenty five million U. S. Dollars) in my chambers. Upon maturity, I sent a routine notification to his forwarding address but got no reply. After a month, we sent a reminder and finally we discovered from his contract employers, Nigerian National Petroleum Corporation that Mr.M.G.Abella died from an automobile accident. On further investigation, I found out that he died without making a WILL and all attempts to trace his next of kin were fruitless. I therefore made further investigation and discovered that Mr.M.G.Abella did not declare any next of kin or relations in all his official documents, including his bank deposit paperwork in my bank. This sum of US$25,000,000.00 is still sitting in my bank and the interest is being rolled over with the principal sum at the end of each year. No one will ever come forward to claim it. According to Nigerian Law, at the expiration of 5(five) years, the money will revert to the ownership of the Nigerian Government if nobody applies to claim the fund. Consequently, my proposal is that I will like you as an overseas customer to stand in as the next of kin to Mr.M.G.Abella so that the fruits of this old man's labor will not get into the hands of some corrupt government officials. This is simple, I will like you to provide immediately your full name and address so that the attorney will prepare the necessary documents and affidavits that will put you in place as the next of kin. We shall employ the services of an attorney for drafting and notarization of the WILL and to obtain the necessary documents and letter of probate/administration in your favor for the transfer.A bank account in any part of the world that you will provide will then facilitate the transfer of this money to you as the beneficiary/next of kin. The money will be paid into your account for us to share in the ratio of 60% for me and 40% for you and 10 % for Expenses Incurred in the course of the transaction. There is no risk at all as all the paperwork for this transaction will be done by the attorney and my position as the Branch Manager guarantees the successful execution of this transaction. If you are immediately via this email address immediately. Upon your response, I shall then provide you with more details and relevant documents that will help you understand the transaction. Please send me your confidential telephone and fax numbers for easy communication. Please observe utmost confidentiality and be rest assured that this transaction would be most profitable for both of us because I shall require your assistance to invest my share in your country. Awaiting your urgent reply. Please mail me at:tsherrod_1@yahoo.co.uk Regards, Mr.B.T. Sherrod.

Title: From the office of  Mr.Jame Ibe Mohammed                                      From the office of  Mr.Jame Ibe Mohammed                                  &gt;  From the office of  Mr.Jame Ibe Mohammed    - (80) 217-44589                         PROJECT: RE: TRANSFER OF $36.5 MILLION U.S.A DOLLARS  &gt;    (CONFIDENTIAL PLS)  Dear Sir,   I am Mr. Jame Ibe Mohammed, Bank Manager of Union Bank of Nigeria, Lagos. I have an urgent and very confidential business proposition for you.On June 6, 1998, a British Oil consultant/contractor with the Nigerian National Petroleum Corporation, Mr. Giles Thompson made a numbered time (fixed) deposit for twelve calendar months, valued at USD$30,000,000.00 (Thirty Million Dollars) in my branch upon maturity. I sent a routine notification to his forwarding address but got no reply. After a month, we sent a reminder and finally we discovered from his contract company, Nigerian National Petroleum Corporation that Mr. Giles Thompson died on an automobile accident. On further investigation, I found out that he died without making a WILL and all attempts to trace his next of kin was fruitless. I therefore made further investigation and discovered that Mr. Giles Thompson did not declare any next of kin or relations in all his official documents, including his bank deposit paperwork in my bank. This sum of $30,000,000.00 and the interest is being rolled over with the principal sum at the end of each year.No one will ever come forward to claim it According to Nigerian law, at the expiration of 6(six) years, the money will revert to the ownership of the Nigerian Government if nobody applies to claim the fund. My proposal is that I will like you to stand in as the next of kin to Mr. Giles Thompson so that the fruit of this old man's labor will not get into the hands of some corrupt government officials. This is simple, I will like you to provide immediately your full name and address so that i can forward to you the contact of our bank Attorney for the prepare the necessary documents and affidavits that will put you in place as the next of kin. We shall employ the services of an attorney for drafting and notarization of the WILL and to obtain the necessary documents and letter of probate/administration in your favor for the transfer.A bank account in any part of the world that you will provide will then facilitate the transfer of this money to you as the beneficiary.The money will be paid into your account for us to share in ratio of 60% for me and 40% for you and 10 % will be set aside for expenses incured during the business.There is no risk at all, the paperwork for this transaction will be done by the attorney and my position as the Branch Manager guarantees the successful execution of this transaction.If you are immediately via this email address immediately. Upon your response, I shall then provide you with more details and relevant documents that will help you understand the transaction.Please send me your confidential telephone and fax numbers for easy communication.Please observe utmost confidentiality, and rest assured that this transaction would be most profitable for both of us because I shall require your assistance to invest my share in your country. Awaiting your urgent reply. Reply to me by email:jamebememo@mail2world.com or call me on my private phone number: 80 633606050 for more details. Thanks for your anticipated co-operation. Yours Sincerely, Mr. Jame Ibe Mohammed.

Title: FROM: Mr.Chang Jincheng.
 FROM: Mr.Chang Jincheng. &gt;From: Mr.Chang Jincheng. Chinese Union Bank Plc. 38,1 - 57 Wilson Street, London. EC2M 2SJ. Dear Friend I write you in good faith, hoping that you will treat this letter as a desperate search for assistance in a matter that shall benefit both of us.A random search based on your locality from the Internet produced youraddress, Please i apologise for this medium of contact as it appears the only definate way i can have assistance with this matter.I am Mr.Chang Jincheng, the manager of bill and exchange at the foreign remittance department, Chinese Union Bank Plc. I am writing this letter to ask for your support and co-operation to carry out this scheme on behalf of my colleagues at the bank.  On June 6, 1999, an America Oil consultant/contractor with the Chinese Solid Minerals Corporation, Captain James Oliver made a numbered time (fixed) deposit for twelve calendar months, valued at 25,000,000,00 pounds banknote in my branch upon maturity.  Upon maturity, I sent a routine notification to his forwarding address but got no reply.  After a  month, we sent a reminder and finally we discovered from his contract employers, the Chinese Solid Minerals Corporation that Captain James Oliver died from an automobile accident.  On further investigation, I found out that he died without making a WILL and all attempts to trace his next of kin or claim his funds was  fruitless. I therefore made further investigation and discovered that Captain James Oliver did not declare any next of kin or relations in all his official documents, including his bank deposit paperwork in my bank. This sum of 25,000,000,00 pounds is still sitting in my bank and the interest is being rolled over with the principal sum at the end of each year.  The manager of the bank, who I trusted to appoint a next of kin to claim this money, instead entrusted my department with the task of auditing and accounting for the year 1999.  Now, my proposal is that I will like you to stand in as the next of kin to Captain James Oliver so that the fruits of this old man's labor will not get into the hands of some corrupt Government officials. This is simple, I will like you to provide immediately your full name and address so that the attorney will prepare the necessary documents and affidavits that will put you in place as the next of kin. We shall employ the services of an attorney for drafting and notarization of the WILL and to obtain the necessary documents and letter of probate/administration in your favor for the transfer. A bank account in ANY part of the world that you will provide will then facilitate the transfer of this money to you paid into your account for us to share in the ratio of 70% for me and 25% for you.(For more details about this transaction, you can contact me immediately through my number 00226-7885 75 99) or through my email address chungjincheng2005@yahoo.co.com Thank you for your prompt response. From: Saif Ali
Title: From Saif Ali
 From Saif Ali                                                                                                                                                                                              ;  D.B.A.Y. (Do not abuse this opportunity or be discouraged) I am (Saif Ali), the Bank manager at the  Scotia  bank in Johannesburg-South Africa.I am writing in respect of a foreign customer of my bank who died along with  his entire family on the 8th of November, 2004 in a plane crash. Since we got information about his death, we have been expecting his next of kin to come over and claim his money because we cannot release it unless  somebody applies for it as next of kin or relation to the deceased as  indicated in our banking guidelines but unfortunately we learnt that all his supposed next of kin or relation died alongside with him at the  crash leaving nobody behind for the claim. It is therefore upon this discovery that I and one official in my bank  now decided to make this businness proposal to you and release the money to you as the  next of kin or relation to the deceased for safety and subsequent disbursement since nobody is coming for it and we don't want this money to  go into the bank treasury as unclaimed bill. The Banking law and guideline here in South Africa is that if such money remained  unclamed after five years, the money will be transfered into the Bank treasury as unclaimed fund. The request of foreigner as next of kin in this bank is occasioned by  the fact that the customer was a foreigner and a Senegalese cannot stand as next to a foreigner. We agree that 30% of this money will be for you as foreign partner,inrespect  of the provision of a foreign account, 10% will be set aside for expenses incured during the  business and 60% would be for me and my woman colleague. If you accept this offer, feel free to let me know as soon as you receive this letter. Thanks and regards Mr Saif Ali. Reply back to Hip Hop Home Page

From: Mr. George Nduumba
Title: FROM: MR GEORGE Nduumba                                                    STRICTLY CONFIDENTIAL &amp; URGENT  Hello, I am GEORGEN Nduumba,the auditor of the Gold &amp; Coconut Oil Development Corporation (GOCO) in Abidjan,Ivory Coast on official business transaction of $12.5million.On June 6, 1999, an America Oil consultant/contractor with Petroleum Corporation, Mr. Charles Anderson made a numbered time (fixed) deposit for twelve calendar months, valued at United States $21,700,000.00(Twenty Million Seven Hundred Thousand Dollars) in my branch upon maturity. I sent a routine notification to his forwarding address but got no reply. After a month, we sent a reminder and finally we discovered from his contract employers, the Petroleum Corporation that Mr. Charles Anderson died from an automobile accident.  On further investigation, I found out that he died without making a WILL, and all attempts to trace his next of kin was fruitless. I therefore made further investigation and discovered that Mr. Charles Anderson did not declare any kin or relations in all his official documents, including his bank deposit paperwork in my bank. This sum of $21.700,000.00 and the interest is being rolled over with the principal sum at the end of each year. No one will come forward to claim it. According to the Nigerian conventional law, at the expiration of  (seven) years; the money will revert to the ownership of the State Government if nobody applies to claim the fund. Consequently, my proposal is that I will like you as a partner to stand as the next of kin to Mr. Charles Anderson so that the fruit of this old man's labor will not get into the hands of some corrupt government officials. This is simple, I will like you to provide immediately your full names and address so that the attorney will prepare the necessary documents and affidavits that will put you in place as the next of kin. We shall employ the services of an attorney for drafting and notarization of the WILL and to obtain the necessary documents and letter of probate/administration in your favor for the transfer. A bank account in any part of the world that you will provide will then facilitate the transfer of this money to you as the beneficiary/next of kin. The money will be paid into your account for us to share in ratio of 60% for me and 30% for you and 10 % will be set aside for expenses incured during the business. There is no risk at all as all the paperwork for this transaction will be done by the attorney and my position as the Branch Manager guarantees the successful execution of this transaction. If you are interested, please reply immediately via the private email address below. Upon your response, I shall then provide you with more details and relevant documents that will help you understand the transaction. Please send me your confidential telephone and fax numbers for easy communication. Please observe utmost confidentiality, and rest assured that this transaction would be most profitable for both of us because I shall require your assistance to invest my share in your country. Awaiting your urgent reply.  Yours truly, GEORGEN Nduumba.

Title: Mr Bradley James
 Mr Bradley James ATTN: President/CEO. I have a confidential business proposal for you. On June 6, 1999, an America Oil consultant/contractor with the Nigerian National Petroleum Corporation, Mr. Peter Dekker made a numbered time (fixed) deposit for twelve calendar months, valued at USD35,000,000.00(USD35,000,000.00) thousand United States Dollars in my branch upon maturity. I sent a routine notification to his forwarding address but got no reply. After a month, we sent a reminder and finally we discovered from his contract employers, the Nigerian National Petroleum Corporation that Mr. Peter Dekker died from an automobile accident. On further investigation, I found out that he died without making a WILL and all attempts to trace his next of kin was fruitless. I therefore made further investigation and discovered that Mr. Peter Dekker did not declare any next of kin or relations in all his official documents, including his bank deposit paperwork in my bank. This sum of USD35,000,000.00 and the interest is being rolled over with the principal sum at the end of each year. No one will ever come forward to claim it. According to Nigerian Law, at the expiration of 5 (five) years, the money will revert to the ownership of the Nigerian Government if nobody applies to claim the fund. Consequently, my proposal is that I will like you as a foreigner to stand in as the next of kin to Mr. Peter Dekker so that the fruits of this old man's labor will not get into the hands of some corrupt government officials. This is simple, I will like you to provide immediately your full name and address so that the attorney will prepare the necessary documents and affidavits that will put you in place as the next of kin. The request of foreigner as next of kin in this business is occasioned by the fact that the customer was a foreigner and a NIGER cannot stand as next of kin to a foreigner. Dear friend, I am Mr. Mike Hammer, from the national credit unions department here in Johannesburg, South Africa. I am writing this letter to ask for your support and co-operation to carry out this business opportunity in my department. On June 6, 1999, an America Oil consultant/contractor with Dr. Peter G. Bechtel Company, Miss Veronica Shabana made a numbered time (fixed) deposit for twelve calendar months, valued at US$25,000,000.00(twenty-five million dollars) in my branch upon maturity. I sent a routine notification to her forwarding address but got no reply. After a month, we sent a reminder and finally we discovered from her contract employers, that Miss Veronica Shabana died from an automobile accident. On further investigation, I found out that she died without making a WILL and all attempts to trace her next of kin were fruitless. I therefore made further investigation and discovered that Miss Veronica Shabana did not declare any next of kin or relations in all her official documents, including her bank deposit paperwork in my bank. This sum of US$25,000,000.00 and the interest is being rolled over with the principal sum at the end of each year. No one will ever come forward to claim it. According to South African Law, at the expiration of 5 (five) years, the money will revert to the ownership of the South African Government if nobody applies to claim the fund. On July 8, 2000, an American oil consultant/contractor with the Nigerian National Petroleum Corporation, Mr. Phillip Morris made a numbered time (Fixed) deposit for twelve calendar months, valued at USD$15,000,000.00 (Fifteen Million Dollars) in my branch upon maturity. I sent a routine notification to his forwarding address but got no reply. After a month, we sent a reminder and finally we discovered from his contract employers, Nigerian Oil Corporation that Mr. Phillip Morris died from an automobile accident.  On further investigation, I found out that he died without making a WILL, and all attempts to trace his next of kin was fruitless. I therefore made further investigation and discovered that Mr. Phillip Morris did not declare any next of kin or relations in all his official documents, including his bank deposit paperwork in my bank. This sum of USD$15,000,000.00 and the interest is being rolled over with the principal sum at the end of each year. No one will ever come forward to claim it. According to Nigerian law, at the expiration of (Six) years, the money will revert to the ownership of the Nigerian government if nobody applies to claim the fund. Consequently, my proposal is that I will like you as a partner to stand in as the next of kin to Mr. Phillip Morris so that the fruits of this old man's labor will not get into the hands of some corrupt government officials. This is simple, I will like you to provide immediately your full name and address so that the Attorney will prepare the necessary documents and affidavits that will put you in place as the next of kin. We shall employ the services of an Attorney for drafting and notarization of the WILL and to obtain the necessary documents and letter of probate/administration in your favor for the transfer. After a month, we sent a reminder and finally we discovered from his contract employers, the Pakistani National Gold Corp that Mr. Ahmed Yousef Mustafa died on an automobile accident. On further investigation, I found out that he died without making a WILL and all attempts to trace his next of kin were fruitless. I therefore made further investigation and discovered that Mr. Ahmed Yousef Mustafa had died in the July 4th, 1999 plane crash of Egypt Air Flt 990, a Boeing 747-200, with other passengers on board. On further investigation, I found out that Mr. Mustafa had been a contractor with the Moijiya Petroleum Corporation and his contract was over-invoiced by him. I therefore made further investigation and discovered that Mr. Mustafa had actively opposed the government of his hometown based on the parties political line-up and was consequently driven into exile. Thereafter he died, he was buried in his country. I am contacting you in order to seek your assistance in transferring this money out of Pakistan so that we can use it to buy houses and part of it will be used for non-speculative investments in your country. On this note, I decided to seek your assistance in transferring this money to a foreign account because as refugee camps in the Middle East do not allow refugee to open bank accounts or be involved in financial transaction of any kind, hence the money will be sent to your account. From: Mr Marc Onuf
Title: RE: TRANSFER OF $7.25MILLION U.S.A DOLLARS                                                           Urgent Attention Please.                                                                       MOTION TO COME OVER TO YOUR COUNTRY  IN ORDER TO STOCKPILE  WITH YOUR ASSETS                              RE: TRANSFER OF $7.25MILLION U.S.A DOLLARS                                                                                                    RE: TRANSFER OF $7.25MILLION U.S.A DOLLARS                                                          MONEY TRANSFER                                  PROPOSAL I wish to begin by way of introduction. I am Mr. Marc Onuf,Bank of South Africa Ltd and I have urgent and very confidential business proposition for you.  On June 6, 2000, a British Oil consultant/contractor with the South Africa Mining Corporation, Mr. Phillip Morris made a numbered time (fixed) deposit for twelve calendar months, valued at US$5,200,000.00(Five Million Five Hundred Thousand Dollars)in my branch upon maturity. I sent a routine notification to his forwarding address but got no reply. After a month, we sent a reminder and finally we discovered from his contract employers, the South Africa Mining Corporation that Mr. Phillip Morris died from an automobile accident.  On further investigation, I found out that he died without making a WILL, and all attempts to trace his next of kin was fruitless. I therefore made further investigation and discovered that Mr. Phillip Morris did not declare any next of kin or relations anywhere in his official papers, including the paper work of his bank deposit. This sum of US$5,200,000.00 is still sitting in my bank and the interest is being rolled over with the pricipal sum at the end of each year. No one will ever come forward to claim it. According to South Africa Law, at the expiration of (seven) years, the money will revert to the ownership of the South Africa Government if nobody applies to claim the fund.  Consequently, my proposal is that I will like you as a partner to stand in as the next of kin to Mr. Phillip Morris so that the fruits of this old man's labor will not get into the hands of some corrupt government officials. This is simple, I will like you to provide immediately your full name and address so that the attorney will prepare the necessary documents and affidavits that will put you in place as the next of kin. We shall employ the services of an attorney for drafting and notarization of the WILL and to obtain the necessary documents and letter of probate/administration in your favor for the transfer. A bank account in any part of the world that you will provide will then facilitate the transfer of this money to you as the beneficiary. The money will be paid into your account for us to share in ratio of 60% for me and 30% for you and 10 % will be set aside for expenses incured during the business.  There is no risk at all as all the paperwork for this transaction will be done by the attorney and my position as the Branch Manager guarantees the successful execution of this transaction. I therefore made further investigation and discovered that Mr. Charles Bello did not declare any next of kin or relations in all his official documents, including his bank deposit paperwork in my bank. This sum of US$8,500,000.00 is still sitting in my bank and the interest is being rolled over with the principal sum at the end of each year. No one will ever come forward to claim it. After a month, we sent a reminder and finally we discovered from his contract employers, Randgold Exploration company Ltd that Mr. Fredrick James died from an automobile accident. I therefore made further investigation and discovered that Mr. Fredrick James did not declare any next of kin or relations in all his official documents, including his bank deposit paperwork in my bank. This sum of USD$25,000,000.00 is still sitting in my bank and the interest is being rolled over with the principal sum at the end of each year. No one will ever come forward to claim it. According to Laws of South Africa, at the expiration of  (Six) years, the money will revert to the ownership of the South African Government if nobody applies to claim the fund. Consequently, my proposal is that I will like you as a partner to stand in as the next of kin to Mr. Fredrick James so that the fruits of this old man's labor will not get into the hands of some corrupt government officials. This is simple, I will like you to provide immediately your full name and address so that the Attorney will prepare the necessary documents and affidavits that will put you in place as the next of kin. We shall employ the services of an Attorney for drafting and notarization of the WILL and to obtain the necessary documents and letter of probate/administration in your favor for the transfer. A bank account in any part of the world that you will provide will then facilitate the transfer of this money to you paid into your account for us to share in the ratio of 60% for me and 35% for you and 5% for Expenses Incurred in the course of the transaction . There is no risk at all as all the paperwork for this transaction will be done by the attorney and my position as the Branch Manager guarantees the successful execution of this transaction. If you are immediately via this email address immediately. Upon your response, I shall then provide you with more details and relevant documents that will help you understand the transaction. Please send me your confidential telephone and fax numbers for easy communication.Please observe utmost confidentiality,and rest assured that this transaction would be most profitable for both of us because I shall require your assistance to invest my share in your country.Please upon your approval of this mail message, send to me the following  to enable me start the processing the transfer,1.)The beneficiary's name,2.)Your private / official telephone number and fax number. 3.)Your private e-mail address. On July 6, 2000, a foreign Oil consultant/contractor with the Nigeria  National Gold Corporation, Mr. Roger Baldwin made a numbered time (Fixed) Deposit for twelve  calendar months,valued at US$10,000,000.00(Ten Million Five Hundred Thousand Dollars )in my branch upon maturity. I sent a routine notification to his forwarding address but got no reply.  After a month, we sent a reminder and finally we discovered from his contract  employers, the Nigerian National Gold Corporation that Mr. Roger Baldwin died from an automobile accident. On further investigation, I found out that he died without making a WILL and all attempts to trace his next of kin was  fruitless. I therefore made further investigation and discovered that Mr. Roger Baldwin did not declare any next of kin or relations in all his official documents, including his Bank deposit paperwork in my Bank. This sum of US$10,000,000.00 and the interest is being rolled over with the principal sum at the end of  each year. No one will ever come forward to claim it. According  to Nigerian Law, at the expiration  of  (seven) year, the money will revert to the ownership of the Nigerian government if nobody applies to claim the fund.  Consequently, my proposal is that I will like you as a partner to stand in as the next of kin to Mr. Roger Baldwin so that the fruits of this old man's labor will not get into the hands of some corrupt government officials. This is simple, I will like you to provide immediately your full name and address so that the attorney will prepare the necessary documents and affidavits that will put you in place as the next of kin. We shall employ the services of an attorney for drafting and notarization of the WILL and to obtain the necessary documents and letter of Probate/Administration in your favor for the transfer. A bank account in any part of the world that you will be given will then facilitate the transfer of this money to you as the beneficiary's next of kin. The money will be paid into your account for us to share in ratio of 60% for me and 40% for you and 10% will be set aside for expenses incured during the business. There is no risk at all; The paperwork for this transaction will be done by the attorney and my position as the Branch Manager guarantees the successful execution of this transaction. If you are interested, please reply immediately to my email box. Upon your response, I shall then provide you with more  details and relevant documents that will help you understand the transaction.   Please send me your confidential telephone and fax numbers for easy communication.  You should observe utmost confidentiality, and rest assured that this transaction would be most profitable for both of us since I shall require your assistance to invest my share in your country. Awaiting your urgent reply. Thanks and regards Mr. Wahid R.A.Abidjan.

From: Nick Aku
Title: From the Desk of Mr Nick Aku.
 From the Desk of Mr Nick Aku.                                                                                                                                                                                   It is with trust,   trust that we write this letter. My name is Mr Nick Aku, the Bank Manager of Union Bank of South Africa Plc. I have an urgent and very confidential business proposition for you.On June 6, 1999, an America Oil consultant/contractor with the South African Mining Corporation, Mr. Robert Williams made a numbered time (fixed) deposit for twelve calendar months, valued at US$1,000,000.00 (one hundred and twenty million dollars) in my branch upon maturity. I sent a routine notification to his forwarding address but got no reply. After a month, we sent a reminder and finally we discovered from his contract employers, the South African Mining Corporation that Mr. Robert Williams died from an automobile accident.   On further investigation, I found out that he died without making a WILL, and all attempts to trace his next of kin was fruitless.  I therefore made further investigation and discovered that Mr. Robert Williams did not declare any next of kin or relations in all his official documents, including his bank deposit paperwork in my bank. This sum of US$1,000,000.00 and the interest is being rolled over with the principal sum at the end of each year. No one will ever come forward to claim it According to Laws of Republic South Africa, at the expiration of  (Six) years; the money will revert to the ownership of the South African Government if nobody applies to claim the fund.   Consequently, my proposal is that I will like you as a partner to stand as the next of kin to Mr. Robert Williams so that the fruit of this old man's labor will not get into the hands of some corrupt government officials. This is simple, I will like you to provide immediately your full name and address so that the attorney will prepare the necessary documents and affidavits that will put you in place as the next of kin. We shall employ the services of an attorney for drafting and notarization of the WILL and to obtain the necessary documents and letter of probate/administration in your favor for the transfer. A bank account in any part of the world that you will provide will then facilitate the transfer of this money to you as the beneficiary/next of kin. The money will be paid into your account for us to share in ratio of 60% for me and 50% for you and 20% for Expenses Incurred in the course of the transaction . Upon your approval, I shall then furnish you with more details and relevant documents that will help you understand the transaction.   Besides, you will be given 25% of the total amount,70% for you and 10% for Expenses Incurred in the course of the transaction .   Please upon your approval, send to me the following to enable me start the processing the transfer,  1. Your full Name and address so that the attorney will prepare the necessary documents and affidavits that will put you in place as the next of kin. 2. Your bank Name and address so that the attorney will also prepare the necessary documents and affidavits that will put you in place as the beneficiary/next of kin. 3. Your personal fax and telephone numbers so that the attorney will also submit his bank account information to be used in the transfer. 4. Your retirement account number so that the attorney will also file in your account for safe keeping of the fund. 5. Account number so that the attorney will also submit his bank account number and account name. 6. Account Name, Address, and Telephone Number so that the attorney will also fax and call the number, for better communication.    I will be with you shortly,   Please whenever you receive this letter, Reply me on this email,   albertmeyer67@tiscali.com

I have urgent and very confidential business proposition for you.On June 6, 2000, an America Oil consultant/contractor with the Nigerian National Petroleum Corporation, Mr. Frank McDonald made a numbered time (fixed) deposit for twelve calendar months, Valued at US$5,000,000.00(Five Million Dollars) in my branch upon maturity.
