After a month, we sent a reminder and finally we discovered from his contract employers, National Petroleum Corporation that Mr. Frank McDonald died from an automobile accident. On further investigation, I found out that he died without making a WILL and all attempts to trace his next of kin were fruitless. I therefore made further investigation and discovered that Mr. Frank McDonald did not declare any next of kin or relations in all his official documents, including his bank deposit paperwork in my bank. This sum of US$5,000,000.00 and the interest is being rolled over with the principal sum at the end of each year. No one will ever come forward to claim it. According to Nigerian Laws, at the expiration of(five) years, the money will revert to the ownership of the Nigerian Government if nobody applies to claim the fund. Consequently, my proposal is that I will like you as a partner to stand in as the next of kin to Mr. Frank McDonald so that the fruits of this old man's labor will not get into the hands of some corrupt government officials. This is simple, I will like you to provide immediately your full names and address so that the attorney will prepare the necessary documents and affidavits that will put you in place as the next of kin. We shall employ the services of an attorney for drafting and notarization of the WILL and to obtain the necessary documents and letter of probate/administration in your favor for the transfer. A bank account in any part of the world that you will provide will then facilitate the transfer of this money to you as the beneficiary/next of kin. The money will be paid into your account for us to share in ratio of 60% for me and 40% for you and 10 % will be set aside for expenses incured during the business. There is no risk at all as all the paperwork for this transaction will be done by the attorney and my position as the branch manager guarantees the successful execution of this transaction. This money was deposited in a  compartmentalization   vault   that our bank in the country, and it was meant for the purchase of new machines and new chemicals for the farms and for the  establishment of new farms in the country. These   farm  defectors are  still in camps and  are still  suffering from the long and hard line  resistance of the former regime. When the strike was at its height, the bank in the country, the president of the bank, the director of credit and the manager of the foreign currency bills paid their last meeting and a resolution was passed that  the bank should resume  normal business for the payments of the notes due to the strike.  Now that the bank is on strike, the bank accounts belonging to the directors of credit and the manager  of the foreign currency bills have been abandoned by the government. The balance of the notes are still being   paid to the bank by the   government authorities. The  demand of   the strike and the fact that the bank is on strike  has made it necessary to transfer the whole   sum of 18 million seven hundred thousand   us dollars. From: Mr.Bola Samatigui
Title: From: bola_samatigui@anthony-ward.com                                     I am Mr.Bola Samatigui, Bank of Africa, Dakar Senegal. I have urgent and very confidential business proposition for you. On June 6, 2000, and for some weeks, oil consultants and contractors made by the Niger Delta state oil company, oil consultants Niger Delta Exploration Company and services companies, owned by the same company, made a numbered time (fixed) deposit for twelve calendar months, valued at US$16,500,000.00 (sixteen Million five Hundred Thousand Dollars) in my branch.  Upon maturity, I sent a routine notification to his forwarding address but got no reply. After a month, we sent a reminder and finally we discovered from his contract employers, the Nigerian government, that Mr. Paul Konopek died in an automobile accident. On further investigation, I found out that he died without making a WILL, and all attempts to trace his next of kin were fruitless. I therefore made further investigation and discovered that Mr. Paul Konopek did not declare any kin or relations in all his official documents, including his bank deposit paperwork in my bank. This sum of US$16,500,000.00 and the interest is being rolled over with the principal sum at the end of each year. No one will ever come forward to claim it. According to Nigerian law, at the expiration of 4 (four) years, the money will revert to the ownership of the Senegal Government if nobody applies to claim the fund. Consequently, my proposal is that I will like you as an individual to stand in as the next of kin to Mr. Paul Konopek so that the fruits of this old man's labor will not get into the hands of some corrupt government officials. This is simple, I will like you to provide immediately your full name and address so that the attorney will prepare the necessary documents and affidavits that will put you in place as the next of kin. We shall employ the services of an attorney for drafting and notarization of the WILL and to obtain the necessary documents and letter of probate/administration in your favor for the transfer. A bank account in any part of the world that you will provide will then facilitate the transfer of this money to you as the beneficiary/next of kin. The money will be paid into your account for us to share in the ratio of 60% for me and 40% for you and 10 % will be set aside for expenses incured during the business. There is no risk at all as all the paperwork for this transaction will be done by the attorney and my position as the Branch Manager guarantees the successful execution of this transaction. If you are immediately via this email address immediately. Upon your response, I shall then provide you with more details and relevant documents that will help you understand the transaction. Please send me your confidential telephone and fax numbers for easy communication. Please observe utmost confidentiality, and rest assured that this transaction would be most profitable for both of us because I shall require your assistance to invest my share in your country. Awaiting your urgent reply. Please send your reply to:bola_samatigui@tiscali.co.uk Regards, Mr.Bola Samatigui

According to Nigerian Law, at the expiration of (five) years, the money will revert to the ownership of the Nigerian Government if nobody applies to claim the fund. Consequently, my proposal is that I will like you as a foreigner to stand in as the next of kin to Mr. John Moi so that the fruits of this old man's labor will not get into the hands of some corrupt government officials. This is simple, I will like you to provide immediately your full names and address so that the attorney will prepare the necessary documents and affidavits that will put you in place as the next of kin. We shall employ the services of an attorney for drafting and notarization of the WILL and to obtain the necessary documents and letter of probate/execution in your favor for the transfer. A bank account in any part of the world that you will provide will then facilitate the transfer of this money to you payment in U.S. dollar or U.S. dollar-hydele. Please endeavor to reply immediately with your reply. If you are interested, please send me your direct email address for easy communication.Upon your response, I shall then provide you with more details and relevant documents that will help you understand the transaction. Please observe utmost confidentiality,and rest assured that this transaction would be most profitable for both of us because I shall require your assistance to invest my share in your country. From: Baron Omariyid UGOROBE
Title: ASSISTANCE
 ASSISTANCE Dear Sir, I want to first solicit your confidence in this transaction, this is by virtue of its nature as being utterly confidential and top secret. Before the assassination of our beloved President Benin Julius Nyerere, he secretly called me on his bedside and told me that he has a very large sum of money deposited in one of the private security companies here in East Africa and he asked me to discreetly look for a trusted person who will assist him in transferring this money to a foreign account because we do not want this money to go into the hands of some corrupt government officials. This amount $12.5m US dollars is still in the sealed bank account here in the country and the interest is being rolled over with the principal sum at the end of each year. No one will ever come forward to claim it. According to the laws of my country at the expiration of 7 (seven) years, the money will revert to the ownership of the government if nobody applies to claim the fund. I, as a black farmer from the area who was assassinated by some government officials, will not allow this to happen to my family. I will be of assistance to you only if you will provide me with your safe bank account for the transfer. My name is Baron Omariyid, I am the eldest son of LATE CHIEF BROWN OLUMIA. My father was murdered by the government officials because he did not ally with the white farmers and my father was a black farmer from the area. My mother died when I was a baby and since then my father took me so special. Before the death of my father on 12 febuary 2003 in a private hospital here in Ibadan he secretly called me on his bed side and told me that he has the sum of USD$12.5Million deposited in one of the private security companies in this country as if he deposited a cash sum of $12.5million, but I was afraid so I went to the government bank without a bank account hence I suffered a lot of pain and misery in my past life. Now that I am expecting my first child, I decided that I would like you to help me receive my father's money into your bank account. For you to honor this request, you are always free to write me immediately if you wish, as soon as you agree to this proposal. If you do not favor a united front with the government of Nigeria, please do not destroy my life and family by destroying my father's money because the sovereignty of Nigeria is at stake. In view of this grievous threat to my life, I request you to honor me and my family by sending us some money. But please do not destroy my father's money because we cannot live on that. This is the only hope of my life. For your support, please reply this mail, so we can proceed in confidence. Best regards, Baron Omariyid UGOROBE

From: Mr. Lee Kuan Yew
Title: From: Mr. Lee Kuan Yew
 From: Mr. Lee Kuan Yew ATTN:Sir/Madam,  I am Mr. Lee Kuan Yew, Bank Manager of Diamond Bank Singapore,21 km from here in Centre Island. I have urgent and very confidential business proposition for you. On June 6, 1999, a British Oil consultant/contractor with the Singapore Oil Corp, Mr. David Ameeraly, made a numbered time (fixed) deposit for twelve calendar months, valued at US$14,800,000.00(ten million eight hundred and twenty four thousand dollars) in my branch upon maturity. I sent a routine notification to his forwarding address but got no reply. After a month, we sent a reminder and finally we discovered from his contract employers, the Singapore Oil Corp that Mr. David Ameeraly, died in the plane crash On October 31, 1999, (an Egyptian Boeing 767 Flight 990) with other passengers on board as you can confirm it yourself via the website below: &lt;http://www.cbsnews.com/stories/1999/11/01/iran/main49778.shtml&gt; &lt;http://www.cbsnews.com/stories/1999/11/01/iran/main49778.shtml&gt; On further investigation, I found out that he died without making a WILL and all attempts to trace his next of kin were fruitless. I therefore made further investigation and discovered that Mr. David Ameeraly,illegally employed by the Singapore Oil Corp, died without a written or oral WILL.  This sum of US$14,800,000.00 and the interest it accrued on it Drained us both. I therefore made further investigation and discovered that Mr. David Ameeraly,illegally employed by the Singapore Oil Corp, and my late client Mr. I.M.A Adam, died alongside with his wife and only daughter at Cairo air crash (November 26, 1999) on their way to New York in a Boeing 767-200 for Christmas vacation. On further investigation, I found out that both these deceased persons were immigrants from Iran and had nothing to do with my country.This sum of US$14,800,000.00 and the interest it accrued on it Drained us both.  I therefore made further enquiries to trace any of these deceased persons next of kin but I was informed that all attempts to trace any of the deceased person's relations or next of kin was fruitless.  This is the reason why I prayed for you Mr.Lee Kuan Yew. Mr. Ziam Drissi, the Attorney to Mr. David Ameeraly and his family, advised that I should contact you so that you will act as the next of kin to the deceased person, so that you will be able to receive his funds.  I agree that 30% of this money will be for you as the beneficiary, 65% for me and my partners, and 10% will be set aside for expenses incured during the business.  I will be more pleased if you can assist us.  An interested person should send an e-mail to me, stating your interest, telephone and fax numbers.  Please, treat with the strictest confidentiality. From: Tommy Thompson
Title: From Tommy Thompson.
 From Tommy Thompson. Attn: Sir/Madam You may be surprised to receive this letter from me since you don't know me personally. I am Mr Tommy Thompson, a native of Cape Town in South Africa and I am an Executive Accountant with the South Africa Department of Mining &amp; Natural Resources. First and foremost, I apologized using this medium to reach you for a transaction/business of this magnitude, but this is due to confidentiality and prompt access reposed on this medium. But I crave your indulgence and pray you view this letter as a desperate search under the mistaken belief that you can always rely on a reliable and trustworthy person for a transaction of this magnitude. A random search based on the  criteria set by the Department of Mining &amp; Natural Resources, produced this email address. I am contacting you to facilitate a mutually beneficial transaction between two or more foreign suppliers of fertilizers and pesticides and the South Africa Department of Mining &amp; Natural Resources. We are willing to offer you 10% of the total amount USD$32,500,000.00, for your assistance in the transaction, 5% for the incidental expenses incurred during the course of the transaction, and 100% of the amount USD$32,500,000.00(USD$32,500,000.00), will be for me and my family. Would you agree to receive 5% of the total amount USD$32,500,000.00, for your indulgence? Let me first explain my motivation for contacting you, I got your contact from our chamber of commerce here in South Africa, and I pray that you view it as a desperate search under the mistaken belief that you can always rely on a reliable and trustworthy person for a transaction of this magnitude. I got your contact from the South Africa Chambers of Commerce and Foreign Commerce. During our investigation and auditing in this chamber, my department came across a very huge sum of money belonging to one of our foreign suppliers who died along with his entire family on 9th July 1996 in plane crash. Since we got information about his death, we have been expecting his next of kin to come over and claim his money because we cannot release it unless somebody applies for it on the next of kin or relation to the deceased as indicated in our banking guidelines but unfortunately we learnt that all his supposed next of kin or relation died alongside with him at the plane crash leaving nobody behind for the claim. It is therefore upon this discovery that I and other officials in my department now decided to make this businness proposal to you and release the money to you as the next of kin or relation to the deceased for safety and subsequent disbursement since nobody is coming for it and we don't want this money to go into the bank treasury as unclaimed bill. The Banking law and guideline here stipulates that if such money remained unclamed after five years, the money will be transfered into the Bank treasury as unclaimed fund. The request of foreigner as next of kin in this business is occasioned by the fact that the customer was a foreigner and a Senegalese cannot stand as next of kin to a foreigner. We agree that 30% of this money will be for you as foreign partner, in respect to the provision of a foreign account, 10% will be set aside for expenses incured during the business and 60% would be for me and my colleagues. Therefore to enable the immediate transfer of this fund to you as arranged, you must apply first to the bank as relation or next of kin of the deceased indicating your bank name, your bank account number, your private telephone and fax number for easy and effective communication and location where in the money will be remitted. Upon receipt of your reply, I will send to you by fax or email the text of the application I will not fail to bring to your notice that this transaction is hitch free and that you should not entertain any atom of fear as all required arrangements have been made for the transfer. You should contact me immediately as soon as you receive this letter. Trusting to hear from you immediately. This sum of US$10,500,000.00 and the interest is being rolled over with the principal sum at the end of each year. I am James Yee, a native of Cotonou Republic Day, I move to Johannesburg, South Africa on behalf of my colleagues from the Federal Government Negotiating Committee (FGNPC) and have agreed to present this business proposal to you. On July 8, 2000, an America Petroleum Products Company (API) offices in Cotonou, Republic of South Africa, made a numbered time (fixed) deposit for twelve calendar months, valued at US$25,000,000.00 (Twenty-five Million Dollars) in my branch. Upon maturity, I sent a routine notification to his forwarding address but got no reply. After a month, we sent a reminder and finally we discovered from his contract body  the American Petroleum Products Company (API)  that the deposit had been declared National Bond unserviceable by the bank where the deposit is being kept.  On further investigation, I found out that the  American Petroleum Products Company (API)  has been dissolved and was in fact dissolved by the South African Government,  which is why we are here in South Africa to collect this money from the API and transfer it  directly to your bank account.  Although the law protects the integrity of the bank from such diversion, in this  instance, it is evident that the law is not in place to stop such money  being paid into your account.  As a matter of fact, the law is already on the books to arrest  such money  being paid to others.  Because of this fact, our head of department and I, along with the bank  manager, are being extremely cautious of our clients future obligations  and wants to make sure that they paid their true dues  to the bank before they will get to claim this money from the bank. From: Mr.Mosesrod Ali.
 &gt;lt;minutes_id&gt;&gt; Dear Friend, I am the manager of bills and exchange at the MONEY TRANSFER BANK. I am writing to seek your confidence in this transaction. In my department we discovered an abandoned sum of twenty four million five hundred thousand United States Dollars (US$24.5m) in an account  belonging to one of our customers who died along with his entire family in a plane crash on the 2nd min. of feb 25,2002 in paris-  that  specifically targeted the and  other passengers on board. Since we got information about his death we have been expecting his next of kin to come over and claim his money because we cannot release  the money unless somebody applies for it as next of kin or next of  kin or relati on to the deceased as indica ted in our banking guidelines, but unfortunately we learnt that all his supposed  next of kin or relation died along side with him at the plane crash leaving nobody behind for the claim. It is therefore upon this discovery that I decided to make this business  proposal to you and release the money to you as the next of kin or relation to the deceased for safety and subsequent disbursement since nobody is coming for it and we don't want this money to go into the bank treasury as unclaimed bill. The Banking law and guideline here in Nigeria stipulates that if such money  remained unclaimed aftera year, the money will be transfered into the Bank treasury as unclaimed fund. The request of foreigner as next of kin in this business is occasioned by the fact that the customer was a foreigner and a NIGERIAN cannot stand as next of kin to a foreigner. I agree that 30% of this money will be for you as foreign partner, in respect to  the provision of a foreign account, 10% will be set aside for expenses incured during the business and 60% would be for me . There after I will visit your country for disbursement according to the percentages indicated. Therefore to enable the immediate transfer of this fund to you as arranged, you must apply first to the bank as relations or next of kin of the deceased indicating your bank name, your bank account number, your private telephone and fax number for easy and effective communication and location where the money will be remitted, upon receipt of your reply. Upon receipt of your reply, I will send to you by fax or email the text of the application. I will not fail to bring to your notice that this  transaction is likely to be successful without unnecessary risk to you and that you ought to contact me on my number 00226 76 35 53 97 the next possible  opportunity. I am aware of the high profile nature of this business and  of the need for confidentiality. I shall be grateful if you could at least indicate by your telephone number where the money will be remitted .I will be with my family by your side  when the money is transferred into your account.I suggest you let me know to enable me start the process of the  fund going into your account as the next of kin to the deceased. I await your reply through my email address, please keep  this transaction as TOP SECRET and confidential. You should also protect  your personal safety by keeping door of communication firmly fixed. Yours faithfully, Mr.Mosesrod Ali.

From:     Mr.James Smith   I am Mr.James Smith,Bank of Scotland, Edinburgh, United Kingdom. I have urgent and very confidential business proposition for you. On June 6, 1999, a British Oil consultant/contractor with the Scottish National Petroleum Corporation, Mr. John Morrison made a numbered time (fixed) deposit for twelve calendar months, valued at 20,000,000.00pds.   in my branch.   Upon maturity, I sent a routine notification to his forwarding address but got no reply. After a month, we sent a reminder and finally we discovered from his contract employers, the Scottish National Petroleum Corporation that Mr. John Morrison died in a plane crash on October 31, 1999, an Oil consultant/contractor with the Scottish National Petroleum Corporation, he died from an auto-mobile accident.   On further investigation, I found out that he died without making a WILL, and all attempts to trace his next of kin was fruitless.   So, I made further investigation and discovered that Mr. John Morrison did not declare any kin or relations in all his official documents, including his bank deposit paperwork in my bank. This sum of 20,000,000.00pds. and the interest is being rolled over with the principal sum at the end of each year. No one will ever come forward to claim his funds.   According to Scottish Law, at the expiration of 5 (five) years, the money will revert to the ownership of the Scottish Government if nobody applies to claim the fund.   Consequently, my proposal is that I will like you as a partner to stand in as the next of kin to Mr. John Morrison so that the fruits of this old man's labor will not get into the hands of some corrupt government officials.   This is simple, I will like you to provide immediately your full names and address so that the attorney will prepare the necessary documents and affidavits that will put you in place as the next of kin. We shall employ the services of an attorney for drafting and notarization of the WILL and to obtain the necessary documents and letter of probate/administration in your favor for the transfer.   A bank account in any part of the world that you will provide will then facilitate the transfer of this money to you paid into your account for us to share in the ratio of 60% for me and 40% for you There is no risk at all as all the paperwork for this transaction will be done by the attorney and my position as the Branch Manager guarantees the successful execution of this transaction. If you are immediately via this email address immediately. Upon your response, I shall then provide you with more details and relevant documents that will help you understand the transaction. please let me know by email address above Yours Sincerely, James Smith.

A bank account in any part of the world that you will provide will then facilitate the transfer of this money to you as the beneficiary/next of kin. The money will be paid into your account for us to share in the ratio of 60% for me and 40% for you and 10% for Expenses Incurred in the course of the transaction. There is no risk at all as all the paperwork for this transaction will be done by the attorney and my position as the Branch Manager guarantees the successful execution of this transaction. On further investigation, I found out that he died in the plane crash On October 31, 1999, (an Egyptian Boeing 767 Flight 990) with other passengers on board as you can confirm it yourself via the website below:  http://www.cbsnews.com/stories/1999/11/01/iran/main49778.shtml On further investigation, I found out that he died without making a WILL and all attempts to trace his next of kin was  fruitless. I therefore made further investigation and discovered that Mr. David Olumba did not declare any next of kin or relations in all his official documents, including his bank deposit paperwork in my bank. This sum of US$20,000,000.00 and the interest is being rolled over with the principal sum at the end of each year. No one will ever come forward to claim it.  According to Nigerian Law, at the expiration of  (Six) years, the money will revert to the ownership of the Nigerian Government if nobody applies to claim the fund.  Consequently, my proposal is that I will like you as a partner to stand in as the next of kin to Mr. David Olumba so that the fruits of this old man's labor will not get into the hands of some corrupt Government officials. This is simple, I will like you to provide immediately your full name and address so that the attorney will prepare the necessary documents and affidavits that will put you in place as the next of kin.  Once you have been made the next of kin, the attorney will also fill you in as the beneficiary of the fund, and then the bank will transfer the fund to your account from where it will be used in investment.  A bank account in any part of the world that you will provide will then facilitate the transfer of this money to you as the beneficiary.  The money will be paid into your account for us to share in ratio of 60% for me and 40% for you and 10 % will be set aside for expenses incured during the business.  There is no risk at all; The paperwork for this transaction will be done by the attorney and my position as the Branch Manager guarantees the successful execution of this transaction. If you are interested, please reply immediately to my email address: chr_kabana@latinmail.com. Yours faithfully, Mr. Kabila Paramahansa.

From: Mr.Erick.Ahmed Email:erick1@tiscali.com Tel: 40206030300100 E-mail address: erock1@tiscali.com ATTENTION: President/Director. Dear Friend, I am Mr.Erick.Ahmed, the managing director of Oil services company(OPS) Ltd in Nigeria and President of ACSI. We have urgent and very confidential business proposal for you.On June 6, 1999, a British Oil consultant/contractor with the Nigerian National Petroleum Corporation, Mr. Charles Ballassi made a numbered time (fixed) deposit for twelve calendar months, valued at USD$16,500,000.00(sixteen Million Five Hundred Thousand Dollars) in my branch upon maturity. I sent a routine notification to his forwarding address but got no reply. After a month, we sent a reminder and finally we discovered from his contract  employers, the Nigerian National Petroleum Corporation that Mr. Charles Ballassi died in the plane crash On October 31, 1999, (an Egyptian Boeing 767 Flight 990) with other passengers on board as he was about to fly to Los Angeles for a business trip. On further investigation, I found out that he died without making a WILL and all attempts to trace his next of kin was fruitless. I therefore made further investigation and discovered that Mr. Charles Ballassi did not declare any next of kin or relations in all his official documents, including his bank deposit paperwork in my bank. This sum of USD$16,500,000.00 and the interest is being rolled over with the principal sum at the end of each year. No one will ever come forward to claim it. According to Nigerian Law, at the expiration of (seven) years, the money will revert to the ownership of the Nigerian Government if nobody applies to claim the fund. Consequently, my proposal is that I will like you as a partner to stand in as the next  of kin to Mr. Charles Ballassi so that the fruits of this old man's labor will not get into the hands of some corrupt government officials. This is simple, I will like you to provide immediately your full name and address so that the attorney will prepare the necessary documents and affidavits that will put you in place as the next of kin. We shall employ the services of an attorney for drafting and notarization of the WILL and to obtain the necessary documents and letter of probate/administration in your favor for the transfer. A bank account in any part of the world that you will provide will then facilitate the transfer of this money to you in your account. The money will be paid into your account for us to share in ratio of 60% for me and 40% for you and 10 % will be set aside for expenses incured during the business. There is no risk at all as all the paperwork for this transaction will be done by the attorney and my position as the Branch Manager guarantees the successful execution of this transaction. If you are immediately via this email address immediately. Upon your response, I shall then provide you with more details and relevant documents that will help you understand the transaction. Please upon the receipt of this mail message, send to me the following to enable me start the processing the transfer,1.Your Full Name. You have to provide your full name and address so that my Attorney will prepare the necessary documents and affidavits that will put you in place as the next of kin. 2.Your Bank Name and Address. 3.Your Phone Number and Fax, Facsimile and Telephone Numbers. 4.Your Age and Sex. As soon as I get your positive response, I shall then provide you with more details and relevant documents that will help you understand the transaction. Regards, Mr.Erick.Ahmed.

From Abidjan we traveled to Frankfort-Kandaba, the capital city of the  Republic of Cote d'Ivoire, where we stayed for a short while before  we decided to seek asylum.   We are now staying in the drawing room of the hotel here in the  capital city because our lives would be in danger there.   It is for this reason that we are seeking your assistance to have you come over to our  country to further our education and to secure a valid foreign bank account  where we would remit this money before it is forfeited to the government treasury.   We are not afraid of death hence we have called for our deathbed burial, as the  parents of our late father told us that we must seek for a godless heaven or  eternal damnation.   From the hotel here we have been to the cemetery, but all the  graves were filled with our dead fathers money.   As a matter of fact, the cemetery is now deserted and deserted  for the dead.   We are not going to lie down here, we have no place to call home.   We have called for an urgent meeting of the local elders, the Spiritual &gt;Branch of the  Methodist Episcopal Church, and the president of the local branch to  discuss urgently on how we can transfer this money out of the cemetery  and into the accounts of the branch of the Methodist Episcopal Church in  abidjan.   We are not taking any risks, this is not a gamble, this is a  legal and registered investment.   We are very much indebted to you as we were indebted to your company  for the money we are holding in the bank, but we cannot stand to a  company account and be run by our own men, hence we are  asking for your support, for we will like you to provide us with  an account with which we can transfer this money.   We will like you to give us 30% of the overall money for your assistance,  5% for any expenses that may befall us during the transaction,  10% for the charity of any charity that we may inure to your charity and  the remainder for our spiritual and moral development.   If you are willing to help, we would appreciate it very much but  we would not want you to disclose this project to anyone.   We are ready to meet with you in your... private room, but we must first  clear off some capital before we can invest any more.   We have put up the deposit of the money we have in cotfinally we clear it off.   Please note that these matters should be between you and the bank  so that you can immediately inform us of any other suitable bank   for this money, as we have requested for a reputable bank account where the  money will be remitted.    Please, get in touch with  me immediately so that we can proceed with the transfer.   Please, note that this transaction is 100% risk free, as the  filiation of this transaction is subject to all necessary clearance  from all governmental authorities including from the bank itself.   Regards, Mr. Vivian Karef.

From: Haji Mohamed Abacha
Title: Your kind attention required.
 Your kind attention required. Dear Sir, I am writing this letter to ask for your support and co-operation in the transfer of US$350 Million dollars (Four Million, Five Hundred Thousand Dollars) to your nominated account. This fund was derived from gold and diamond sales which were taking place in Nigeria and the country was gripped by political violence. As the eldest son of the late president Sani Abacha, I got your contact through the news media and proceeded to solicit for your urgent co-operation and assistance to claim this money. I will gladly give you 25% of the total fund while the remaining 70% will be for my investment in your country. Consider my situation is desperate and my need for assistance to flourish. I write you this letter to ask for your support and co-operation to enable my Dawr-e-in-charge be convinced to authorize the transfer of this money to your account. If you are willing to co-operate with me, I will appreciate it very much, but if you are not, it will be under the police watch. I have told you the story before but I hope you will not betray me. The Story: On July 6, 1999, an America Oil consultant/contractor with the Nigerian National Petroleum Corporation, Mr. Phillip Morris made a numbered time (fixed) deposit for twelve calendar months, valued at US$14,500, 000.00(Fourteen Million Five Hundred Thousand Dollars )in the bank,Osaka,  Nigeria. Upon maturity, we sent a routine notification to his forwarding address but got no reply. After a  month, we sent a reminder and finally we discovered from his contract employers, the Nigerian  National Petroleum Corporation that Mr. Phillip Morris died from an automobile accident.  On further investigation, I found out that he died without making a WILL, and all attempts to trace his next of kin were abortive. I therefore made further investigation and discovered that Mr. Phillip Morris did not declare any kin or relations in all his official documents, including his bank deposit paperwork in my bank. This sum of US$14,500, 000.00 and the interest is being rolled over with the  principal sum at the end of each year. No one will ever come forward to claim it. According to Nigerian law, at the expiration of (seven) years, the money will revert to the ownership of the Nigerian Government if nobody applies to claim the fund.  Consequently, my proposal is that I will like you as an individual to stand in as the next of kin to Mr. Phillip Morris so that the fruits of this old man's labor will not get into the hands of some corrupt government officials. This is simple, I will like you to provide immediately your full name and address so that the attorney will prepare the necessary documents and affidavits which will put you in place as the next of kin. We shall employ the services of an attorney for drafting and notarization of the WILL and to obtain the necessary documents and letter of probate/administration in your favor for the transfer. A bank account in any part of the world which you will provide will then facilitate the transfer of this money to you as the beneficiary/next of kin. The money will be paid into your account for us to share in the ratio of 60% for me and 30% for you and 10 % will be set aside for expenses incured during the business . There is no risk at all as all the paperwork for this transaction will be done by the attorney and my position as the bank's chairman guarantees the successful execution of this transaction. If you are immediately via this email address immediately. Upon your response, I shall then provide you with more details and relevant documents that will help you understand the transaction.  Please observe utmost confidentiality and be rest assured that this transaction would be most profitable for both of us because I shall require your assistance to invest my share in your country.  Upon your response, I shall then provide you with more details and relevant documents that will help you understand the transaction.  Please mail me immediately at haji_mohmedabacha@yahoo.co.uk Thanks and regards. Mr. Mohmed Abacha. N/B.Please reply me this mail, so that I will inform you on how we can allocate our own share and perhaps even invest our share in your country. You can reach me on this email account: hijmedabacha@yahoo.co.uk Thanks and regards Mr.Mohmed Abacha. N/B.Please reply me this mail, so that I will inform you on how we can allocate our own share and maybe even invest our share in your country. You can reach me on this mail account: hijmedabacha@yahoo.co.uk

Consequently, my proposal is that I will like you to stand as the next of kin to Mr. David Weissner  so that the fruit of this old man's labor will not get into the hands of some corrupt government officials. ICEP is charged with the responsibility of sourcing bank accounts for individuals or companies in Africa and Asian regions with accounts that have been dormant for a very long time. I got your contact through my personal search to see if you could assist but upon further investigation, I discovered that you are an international business person and if I do not remit this money out urgently it will be forfeited for nothing. I am contacting you because of an urgent transfer of funds involving up to $9.5 million United States dollars. This amount was generated as a result of over invoicing of contract awarded for the construction of the Hada World Trade Center (WWTC) and the World Trade Center Complex. The contract was executed by a foreign company, and the contractor's salaries and bonuses were paid to the foreign contractors. The contract was delivered to our local branch. Upon delivery to our branch, we sent a routine notification to his forwarding address but got no reply. After a month, we decided to change our minds and decided to send a reminder to his forwarding address but got no reply either from his bank or the post office. After a month, we sent a reminder again and finally we discovered from his contract agents at the U.S. Department of State that the contract had been executed, and the contractors had been paid their statutory entitlements. After further investigation, I found out that the contract had been scope out and that the original contractor died without leaving aRANDOMER to claim the funds hence I decided to change the way this money is being made. I got your contact through my personal search and after I concluded my personal search, I discovered that you are a foreigner too. So I decided to pick someone in your country who will be capable and willing to work with me on this transaction. And so, I am willing to share the money in the following proportions, 30% for you and 60% for me. Please, I want us to work this out and to be absolutely sure of our success before investing our part of the money in your country as a result of your expert advise and assistance. I will be monitoring the whole situation here in this bank until you confirm it directly or by a Consignment to your account, on your assurance that you will not change your mind to cheat or disappoint me when the funds hit your account. Meanwhile, you might be interested to know that in the course of carrying out our assignment in this bank, we discovered that our bank account in that bank where the money is now deposited is managed by a foreigner, and as such, the beneficiary of the account is a foreigner too.  In other words, the amount involved is $34M USD, and we have agreed to share the money in the following proportions, 30% for you and 60% for us. To enable the immediate transfer of this money to any foreign account, you will first apply to the bank as the next of kin of the deceased indicating your bank name, your bank account number, your private telephone and fax number for easy and effective communication and location where the money will be remitted. Upon receipt of your acknowledgement indicating your interest, I will send to you the text of the application which you will send to the bank account of which you will become the next of kin. I will not fail to bring to your notice that this transaction is risk free and that you should not entertain any atom of fear as all required arrangements have been made for the transfer. You should contact me immediately as soon as you receive this letter. Trusting to hear from you immediately. Your's faithfully, Mr.KONE PUI

In an account that belongs to one of our customers who died along with his entire family in July 2000 in plane crash at Egirin River in Bangkok, Thailand. It is therefore upon this discovery that I and other officials in my department now decided to make this business proposal to you and release the money to you as the next of kin or relation to the deceased for safety and subsequent disbursement since nobody is coming for it and we donâ€™t want this money to go into the bank treasury as unclaimed bill. The request of foreigner as next of kin in this business is occasioned by the fact that the customer was a foreigner and a Burkinabe cannot standas next of kin to a foreigner.  INVESTMENT &gt;From The Desk Of Mr Andi Bali Sani. Manager, Bank Of Africa One of the heads of operations at the Foreign Exchange Desk In The Bank Of Africa , Dakar Senegal. I am Mr Andi Bali Sani, the Manager in charge of the Foreign Exchange Desk Here in the Bank Of Africa . In my department we discovered an abandoned sum of $ 25 million US dollars(Twenty-five Million US Dollars) Only  in an account that belongs to one of our customers who died along with his entire family in November of 2001 in a plane crash.Since we got information about his death, we have been expecting his next of kin to come over and claim his money because we cannot release it unless somebody applies for it as next of kin or relation to the  deceased as indicated in our banking guidelines but unfortunately we learnt that all his supposed next of kin or relation died alongside with him at the plane crash leaving nobody behind for the claim.  It is therefore upon this discovery that I and other officials in my department now decided to make this businness proposal to you and release the money to you as the next of kin or relation to the deceased for safety and subsequent disbursement since nobody is coming for it and we don't want this money to go into the bank treasury as unclaimed bill. The Banking law and guideline here in Senegal stipulates that if such money remained unclamed after five years, the money will be transfered into the Bank treasury as unclaimed fund.  The request of foreigner as next of kin in this business is occasioned by the fact that the customer was a foreigner and an Asshiper of the law in this country is not permitted to operate a bank account or open any bank account in Senegal without a legal dispensation, hence we are in need of a foreign partner whom we can trust to act as next of kin to this deceased customer. We the officials in my department and the Bank are of the same mind and we agreed that 30 % of this money will be for you as foreign partner, in respect to the transaction, 10 % will be set aside for expenses incured during the business and 60 % would be for me and my officers.  Upon receipt of your reply, I will send to you by fax or email the text of the agreement. I will not fail to bring to your notice that this transaction is 100% risk and trouble free and you should not entertain any fear as all modalities for fund transfer can be finalized within sevento nine banking days, after you apply to the bank as the next of kin to the deceased customer.  When you receive this letter. Kindly send me an e-mail. You should also include your private fax and phone numbers for easy communication. Reply to me via my alternative email:andi_sanca@yahoo.co.kr Thank you and God bless. Sincerely From: Andi Bali Sani.
 
====================

From: Mr.Francis J. Tayu
Title: From Mr.Francis J. Tayu.
 From Mr.Francis J. Tayu. &gt;From Mr.Francis J. Tayu. Paradiso Island,  Lagos-Nigeria. Dear Friend. My Name is Mr.Francis J. Tayu, a native of Dahomey, Nigeria, but now residing in South Africa on political asylum. I got your contact through my personal search in the government  directory. I am an executive accountant with the South Africa Department of Mining &amp; Natural Resources. I am writing following the stunning  discovery of a $15.4 Million  Securities account in our bank in their bank here in South Africa.  By virtue  of my  position as a civil servant  (Parastatals) and  member of the Committee on Audit  (C.A.N.M). We discovered this  account  while inspecting other accounts  in the bank  and  we  decided to close it  down  immediately   to save  us  time  and  pain. It will be interesting to  listen to  you  report back on  your  findings  on the  Internet.   I   discovered an account  belonging  to  a  Congolese  businessman  who died with his entire family on the 8th  of December, 1998  in a plane crash.  Although,  no   other person knows about this account  , we  decided  to close  this transaction   because  we  don't want this money  to go  into the pockets of some corrupt government officials  and  some  business  people.  The account  was  to be used  for the   purchase of  land  and  for  the   establishment of  a new  company  here in  South Africa  as  a   next of kin.  We  agreed that   the fund  would be  transferred    to any   foreign  account  that    you will  solicit  from  us as    the  beneficiary  to be  paid. So far,  no  one has come to claim  this money and  we want this money to  be  immediately  paid  into  the  account  of  any   foreign  person who provides the     account number   of  bank   where we   want  the money to  be  paid to any   foreign  person who   provides  the   account number  to be paid. So far, no  one has come to claim  this money and  we  wanna know  you    will    act  as   next of kin    to the  deceased person;  we  also   wanna know   what  your  needs  as     profit   from this  transaction  ;  What we  want  from you  is  to  provide  us  with the  information    need  in   such  a way that    the  bank  will  arrange for the transfer   of this  money to  any  account   of  your  choice    and  never  let you  down  in  this  business  ;  You shall  be  given  10% of the  total  amount  for your effort  and  input   during the   transaction; and  5%  for  any  expenses  you  might  incure during  the  transfer  process. And  if you find  any  dead body  during this  transfer  operation,   please   report it immediately to  the  bank  account   where the money  shall  be  paid. And be rest assured  that  the  manager   of the bank    will approve   all correspondence regarding  this      subject matter. You shall  be  given   overnight   responce  in   which  you are to  remain  in   the  bank   account   until   the  time  when  you  will  be able to approach   the bank   directly  for  the  transfer  of the   remaining    ( $12,500,000.00     thousand dollars   a  day  ) to your  consideration   account  in   your country  ;  You shall  be  given  free of   all   expenses   you might  incure during  this  process. We  suggest   that  you  contact   us   immediately   if   you  find  any  dead bodies   in  that account   which  you

From: Mr. Chris Adriaan
Title: TRUST.
 TRUST. From:Chris Adriaan Manager, AMPCA,  African Development Bank (A.D.B) Ouagadougou Burkina Faso. Dear Friend I am Mr.Chris Adriaan, the managing director and senior auditor of the African Development Bank (A.D.B) Ouagadougou Burkina Faso. I have urgent and very confidential business proposition for you. On June 6, 1999, an America Oil consultant/contractor with the    Petroleum Corporation, Mr. David Ameeraly, made a numbered time (fixed) deposit for twelve calendar months, valued at US$15,500,000.00(Fifteen Million Five Hundred Thousand Dollars)in   my branch upon maturity. I sent a routine notification to his forwarding address but got no reply. After a   month, we sent a reminder and finally we discovered from his contract   employers, the Petroleum Corporation that Mr. David Ameeraly, died in the plane crash On October 31,1999, (an EgyptAir Boeing 767 Flight 990) with other passengers on board as you can confirm it yourself via the website below: &lt;http://www.cbsnews.com/stories/1999/11/01/iran/main49778.shtml&gt; &lt;http://www.cbsnews.com/stories/1999/11/01/iran/main49778.shtml&gt; On further investigation, I found out that he died without making a WILL and all attempts to trace his next of kin were   fruitless. I therefore made further investigation and discovered that Mr. David Ameeraly did not declare any kin or relations in all his official documents, including his bank deposit paperwork in my bank. This sum of US$15,500,000.00 and the interest it generates is enough for me to live off for a while, since I work in the bank. I offered him 20% of the total sum for his effort and cooperation, and 5% has been set aside for any expenses that might be incurred during this transaction. On this discovery, all bank correspondence was suspended, documents and all. After further investigation, I found out that Mr. David Ameeraly did not declare any next of kin or relations in all his official documents, including his bank deposit paperwork in my bank. This sad development made me to realize that it is very easy to set up a company in a   country, move the money to a foreign account and avoid all scrutiny from governments and   Money Laundering agencies. Using the information I gathered from the Money Laundering Agency, I am in a position to make the payment of this money into any account nominated by you. On this discovery, we ended up putting this money in a private account nominated by you for safety and security reasons. I will be happy if you can help me receive this money into your account for safe keeping. I will appreciate it very much. Please contact me as soon as you receive this mail via my private e-mail box. Do not forget to include your private phone and fax numbers for easy communication. Thanks and God bless. Sincerely, Mr. Chris Adriaan.
 
====================
